00050 /** Clean up memory in hashes. */
00051 ChipLayout::~ChipLayout() {
00052   /* Used to iterate through hashes, but it was
00053      very slow as if the memory in ->first is deleted then
00054      can't iterate to next element and calling begin() lots
00055      of times and erase() on each element was sloooow. */
00056   //m_PsNameHash.clear();
00057 }

00059 /** Constructor. */
00060 ChipLayout::ChipLayout() {
00061   m_NumExpression = 0;
00062   m_NumGenotyping = 0;
00063   m_NeedMismatch = true;
00064   m_NeedGc = true;
00065   m_numChannels = 1;
00066   m_NeedPmAlleleMatch = false;
00067   m_haveKillList = false;
00068   m_warningCount = 0;
00069   m_MaxNameLength = 0;
00070   m_XCount = 0;
00071   m_YCount = 0;
00072 }

00074 /**
00075  * Write out a single record to the tsv file supplied.
00076  *
00077  * @param tsv - TsvFile opened and bound.
00078  * @param pL - ProbeList record to write out.
00079  */
00080 void
00081 ChipLayout::writeSpfProbeSetRecord(SpfFile &tsv,const ProbeSet &ps)
00082 {
00083   APT_ERR_ASSERT(tsv.m_spf_format==2,"Only format v2 is supported for now.");
00084 
00085   // block counts;
00086   string block, blockAnn;
00087 
00088   // Setup the block sizes
00089   int bIx = 0;
00090   for (bIx = 0; bIx < ps.numGroups - 1; bIx++) {
00091     block += ToStr(ps.atomsPerGroup[bIx]) + ",";
00092   }
00093   block += ToStr(ps.atomsPerGroup[bIx]);
00094 
00095   // Figure out the block annotations based on type and block number number
00096   vector<int> blockAnnVec(ps.numGroups, ProbeList::NoAnnotation);
00097   if (ps.numGroups == 4 && 
00098      (ps.psType == ProbeSet::GenoType)) {
00099     blockAnnVec[0] =  ProbeList::A_AlleleForward;
00100     blockAnnVec[1] = ProbeList::B_AlleleForward;
00101     blockAnnVec[2] = ProbeList::A_AlleleReverse;
00102     blockAnnVec[3] = ProbeList::B_AlleleReverse;
00103   }
00104   else if (ps.numGroups == 2 && 
00105           (ps.psType == ProbeSet::GenoType)) {
00106     blockAnnVec[0] =  ProbeList::A_Allele;
00107     blockAnnVec[1] =  ProbeList::B_Allele;
00108   }
00109   for (bIx = 0; bIx < ps.numGroups - 1; bIx++) {
00110     blockAnn += ToStr(blockAnnVec[bIx]) + ",";
00111   }
00112   blockAnn += ToStr(blockAnnVec[bIx]);
00113 
00114   int pmCount = ProbeListFactory::countPmProbes(&ps);
00115   int probeCount = pmCount;
00116   bool hasMM = ProbeListFactory::hasNonPm(ps);
00117   if (hasMM) {
00118     probeCount = 2*probeCount;
00119   }
00120 
00121   string probes;
00122   int pIx = 0;
00123   vector<int> probeVec(probeCount, ProbeList::null_probe);
00124   int pCount = 0;
00125   vector<int> atomProbes(ps.atoms.size(), 0);
00126   // fill in the probes.
00127   for (uint32_t atomIx = 0; atomIx < ps.atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
00128     Atom *a = ps.atoms[atomIx];
00129     for (uint32_t probeIx = 0; probeIx < a->probes.size(); ++probeIx) {
00130       Probe *current = a->probes[probeIx];
00131       Probe *next = NULL;
00132       atomProbes[atomIx]++;
00133       if (probeIx +1 < a->probes.size()) 
00134         next = a->probes[probeIx + 1];
00135       // if it is an pm-mm set then put pm in front and mm in matching position.
00136       if (Probe::isPm(*current) && next != NULL && Probe::isMm(*next)) {
00137         probeVec[pCount] =  current->id;
00138         probeVec[pCount + pmCount] = next->id;
00139         probeIx++; // advance probeIx count as we did two.
00140       }
00141       // if it is a lone mm then put a "null_probe" in for the pm probe.
00142       if (!Probe::isPm(*current)) { 
00143         probeVec[pCount] = ProbeList::null_probe;
00144         probeVec[pCount + pmCount] =  current->id;
00145       }
00146       // lone pm probe
00147       else {
00148         probeVec[pCount] =  current->id;
00149       }
00150       pCount++;
00151     }
00152   }
00153   for (pIx = 0; pIx < probeVec.size() -1; pIx++) {
00154     int oneBase = probeVec[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe ? 1 : 0;
00155     probes += ToStr(probeVec[pIx] + oneBase) + ",";
00156   }
00157   int oneBase = probeVec[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe ? 1 : 0;
00158   probes += ToStr(probeVec[pIx] + oneBase);
00159 
00160   // write the SPF record
00161   int count = 0;
00162   tsv.set(0, count++, ps.name);
00163   //
00164   tsv.set(0, count++, ps.psType);
00165   tsv.set(0, count++, ps.numGroups);
00166   tsv.set(0, count++, block);
00167   tsv.set(0, count++, blockAnn);
00168   //
00169   if (hasMM) 
00170     tsv.set(0, count++, 2);
00171   else 
00172     tsv.set(0, count++, 1);
00173   //
00174   tsv.set(0, count++, probeCount);  
00175   tsv.set(0, count++, probes);
00176   //
00177   tsv.writeLevel(0);
00178 }
00179 
00180 /** 
00181  * Write out a single record to the tsv file supplied.
00182  * 
00183  * @param tsv - TsvFile opened and bound.
00184  * @param pL - ProbeList record to write out.
00185  */
00186 void ChipLayout::writeSpfProbeListRecord(SpfFile &tsv,const ProbeListPacked &pL)
00187 {
00188   APT_ERR_ASSERT(tsv.m_spf_format==2,"Only format v2 is supported for now.");
00189 
00190   // block counts;
00191   string blockSize, blockAnn;
00192   int bIx = 0;
00193   for (bIx = 0; bIx < pL.block_cnt() - 1; bIx++) {
00194     blockSize += ToStr(pL.get_blockSize(bIx)) + ",";
00195     blockAnn += ToStr(pL.get_blockAnn(bIx)) + ",";
00196   }
00197   blockSize += ToStr(pL.get_blockSize(bIx));
00198   blockAnn += ToStr(pL.get_blockAnn(bIx));
00199   string probes;
00200   int pIx = 0;
00201 
00202   // @todo harley Fix this up with ProbeList::toZero
00203   // probe index is 1 based rather than 0 based internals so add 1 if not a null probe
00204   for (pIx = 0; pIx < pL.probe_cnt() - 1; pIx++) {
00205     int oneBase = pL.get_probeId(pIx) != ProbeList::null_probe ? 1 : 0;
00206     probes += ToStr(pL.get_probeId(pIx) + oneBase) + ",";
00207   }
00208   int oneBase = pL.get_probeId(pIx) != ProbeList::null_probe ? 1 : 0;
00209   probes += ToStr(pL.get_probeId(pIx) + oneBase);
00210 
00211   // write the SPF record
00212   // name type num_blocks block_sizes block_annotations num_match num_probes probes
00213   int count = 0;
00214   tsv.set(0, count++, pL.get_name_string()); // name
00215   tsv.set(0, count++, pL.get_type());        // type
00216   tsv.set(0, count++, pL.block_cnt());       // num_blocks
00217   tsv.set(0, count++, blockSize);            // block_sizes
00218   tsv.set(0, count++, blockAnn);             // block_annotations
00219   tsv.set(0, count++, pL.get_numMatch());    // num_match
00220   tsv.set(0, count++, pL.probe_cnt());       // num_probes
00221   tsv.set(0, count++, probes);               // probes
00222   //
00223   tsv.writeLevel(0);
00224 }
00225 
00226 void ChipLayout::openSpfForWrite(affx::SpfFile& spffile,const std::string& fileName,int spfFormat) {
00227   // the standard set of columns
00228   spffile.define_file(spfFormat);
00229   // stuff what will appear in the headers into the vars...
00230   spffile.m_header_chipTypes.clear();
00231   spffile.m_header_chipTypes.push_back(m_Header["chip_type"][0]);
00232   spffile.m_header_numProbesets=getProbeSetCount();
00233   spffile.m_header_numCols=getXCount();
00234   spffile.m_header_numRows=getYCount();
00235   spffile.m_header_numChannels=numChannels();
00236   // ...and this will add the headers in the standard order.
00237   spffile.addStandardHeaders();
00238   // ready for data.
00239   spffile.writeSpf(fileName);
00240 }
00241 
00242 /** 
00243  * Write out our probelist information in our simple probe format
00244  * 
00245  * @param fileName - path to write file out to
00246  */
00247 void ChipLayout::writeSpfProbeList(const std::string& fileName,int spfFormat) {
00248   SpfFile spffile;
00249   openSpfForWrite(spffile,fileName,spfFormat);
00250   int i_max=m_PlFactory.getProbeSetCount();
00251   for (int i = 0; i < i_max; i++) {
00252     writeSpfProbeListRecord(spffile,m_PlFactory.getProbeListAtIndex(i));
00253   }
00254   spffile.close();
00255 }

00257 
00258 ProbeListPacked
00259 ChipLayout::makeProbeListPacked(const std::string& name,
00260                                 int type, int numBlocks,
00261                                 const std::vector<int>& blockSizes,
00262                                 const std::vector<int>& blockAnns,
00263                                 const std::vector<int>& blockAlleles,
00264                                 const std::vector<int>& blockContexts,
00265                                 const std::vector<int>& blockChannels,
00266                                 const std::vector<int>& blockRepTypes,
00267                                 int numMatch,
00268                                 int numProbes,
00269                                 const std::vector<int>& probes)
00270 {
00271   // this shouldnt happen
00272   APT_ERR_ASSERT((numMatch==1||numMatch==2),"numMatch must be 1 or 2.");
00273   APT_ERR_ASSERT(numProbes>0,"Most have at least one probe.");
00274 
00275   //
00276   ProbeListPacked pl = m_PlFactory.add_ProbeList(numBlocks, numProbes, name);
00277   //
00278   pl.set_type(type);
00279   pl.set_numMatch(numMatch);
00280   //
00281   APT_ERR_ASSERT(numBlocks==blockSizes.size()   ,"internal error.");
00282   APT_ERR_ASSERT(numBlocks==blockAnns.size()    ,"internal error.");
00283   APT_ERR_ASSERT(numBlocks==blockAlleles.size() ,"internal error.");
00284   APT_ERR_ASSERT(numBlocks==blockContexts.size(),"internal error.");
00285   APT_ERR_ASSERT(numBlocks==blockChannels.size(),"internal error.");
00286   APT_ERR_ASSERT(numBlocks==blockRepTypes.size(),"internal error.");
00287   //
00288   for (int i = 0; i < numBlocks; i++) {
00289     pl.set_blockSize(i, blockSizes[i]);
00290     pl.set_blockAnn(i, blockAnns[i]);
00291     pl.set_blockAllele(i,blockAlleles[i]);
00292     pl.set_blockContext(i,blockContexts[i]);
00293     pl.set_blockChannel(i,blockChannels[i]);
00294     pl.set_blockRepType(i,blockRepTypes[i]);
00295   }
00296   //
00297   for (int i = 0; i < numProbes; i++) {
00298     pl.set_probeId(i, probes[i]);
00299   }
00300   return pl;
00301 }
00302 
00303 /** 
00304  * Parse the results from one record into a ProbeList if desired,
00305  * othewise just keep track of statistics
00306  * 
00307  * @param name - Probeset identifier.
00308  * @param type - Class of probeset (i.e. genotyping, expression, copynumber) as in ProbeSet::Type enumeration
00309  * @param numBlocks - How many blocks are there in probeset.
00310  * @param blockSizes - Comma separated size in probes of each block.
00311  * @param blockAnns - Comma separated annotation for each block as in ProbeSet::BlockAnnotation enumeration
00312  * @param numMatch - How many matches (1 for pm only, 2 for pm-mm).
00313  * @param numProbes - Total number of probes.
00314  * @param probesStr - Comma separated list of probe ids (indexes).
00315  * @param lineNumber - Line number in file.
00316  * @param keep - Should this probelist be kept after getting statistics.
00317  * @param probeSubSet - Bool array with probes to be loaded marked as true.
00318  */
00319 
00320 void ChipLayout::parseProbeListRecord(const std::string& name,
00321                                       int type,
00322                                       int numBlocks,
00323                                       const std::string& blockSizesStr,
00324                                       const std::string& blockAnnsStr,
00325                                       bool have_blockAlleleStr,
00326                                       const std::string& blockAlleleStr,
00327                                       bool have_blockContextStr,
00328                                       const std::string& blockContextStr,
00329                                       bool have_blockChannelStr,
00330                                       const std::string& blockChannelStr,
00331                                       bool have_blockRepTypeStr,
00332                                       const std::string& blockRepTypeStr,
00333                                       int numMatch,
00334                                       int numProbes,
00335                                       const std::string& probesStr,
00336                                       int lineNumber,
00337                                       bool keep,
00338                                       std::vector<bool> &probeSubSet, 
00339                                       bool keepOrder)
00340 {
00341   vector<int> blockSizes, blockAnns, blockAlleles, blockContexts, blockChannels, blockRepTypes, probes;
00342   //int maxId = m_XCount * m_YCount;
00343   int maxId = getProbeCount();
00344   
00345   // convert the block sizes
00346   Convert::strToIntVec(blockSizesStr, ',', blockSizes);
00347   if (blockSizes.size() != numBlocks) {
00348     Err::errAbort("Probeset: '" + name + "' on line: " + ToStr(lineNumber) +
00349                   " expecting " + ToStr(numBlocks) + " block sizes got " +
00350                   ToStr(blockSizes.size()));
00351   }
00352   // convert the block annotations
00353   Convert::strToIntVec(blockAnnsStr, ',', blockAnns);
00354   if (blockAnns.size() != numBlocks) {
00355     Err::errAbort("Probeset: '" + name + "' on line: " + ToStr(lineNumber) +
00356                   " expecting " + ToStr(numBlocks) + " block annotations got " +
00357                   ToStr(blockAnns.size()));
00358   }
00359   //
00360   if (have_blockAlleleStr) {
00361     Convert::strToIntVec(blockAlleleStr, ',', blockAlleles);
00362     if (blockAlleles.size() != numBlocks) {
00363       Err::errAbort("Probeset: '" + name + "' on line: " + ToStr(lineNumber) +
00364                     " expecting " + ToStr(numBlocks) + " block alleles got " +
00365                     ToStr(blockAlleles.size())+
00366                     " from: '"+blockAlleleStr+"'.");
00367     } 
00368   }
00369   else {
00370     blockAlleles.resize(0);  
00371     blockAlleles.resize(numBlocks,0);
00372     if (type == ProbeSet::GenoType && (numBlocks == 2 || numBlocks == 4)) {
00373       // Unless otherwise specified, alleles for ProbeSet::GenoType
00374       // blocks are determined by their position in the list of
00375       // blocks: 1st and 3rd blocks are allele A, 2nd and 4th blocks
00376       // are allele B.
00377       for (int i = 1; i < numBlocks; i+=2) {
00378         blockAlleles[i] = 1;
00379       }
00380     }
00381   }
00382 
00383   //
00384   if (have_blockContextStr) {
00385     Convert::strToIntVec(blockContextStr, ',', blockContexts);
00386     if (blockContexts.size() != numBlocks) {
00387       Err::errAbort("Probeset: '" + name + "' on line: " + ToStr(lineNumber) +
00388                     " expecting " + ToStr(numBlocks) + " block contexts got " +
00389                     ToStr(blockContexts.size()) +
00390                     " from '"+blockContextStr+"'.");
00391     }
00392   }
00393   else {
00394     blockContexts.resize(0);
00395     blockContexts.resize(numBlocks,0);
00396   }
00397   //
00398   if (have_blockChannelStr) {
00399     Convert::strToIntVec(blockChannelStr, ',', blockChannels);
00400     if (blockChannels.size() != numBlocks) {
00401       Err::errAbort("Probeset: '" + name + "' on line: " + ToStr(lineNumber) +
00402                     " expecting " + ToStr(numBlocks) + " block contexts got " +
00403                     ToStr(blockChannels.size()) +
00404                     " from '"+blockChannelStr+"'.");
00405     }
00406   }
00407   else {
00408     blockChannels.resize(0);
00409     blockChannels.resize(numBlocks,0);
00410   }
00411   //
00412   if (have_blockRepTypeStr) {
00413     Convert::strToIntVec(blockRepTypeStr, ',', blockRepTypes);
00414     if (blockRepTypes.size() != numBlocks) {
00415       Err::errAbort("Probeset: '" + name + "' on line: " + ToStr(lineNumber) +
00416                     " expecting " + ToStr(numBlocks) + " block contexts got " +
00417                     ToStr(blockRepTypes.size()) +
00418                     " from '"+blockRepTypeStr+"'.");
00419     }
00420   }
00421   else {
00422     blockRepTypes.resize(0);
00423     blockRepTypes.resize(numBlocks,0);
00424   }
00425 
00426   // convert the probes
00427   Convert::strToIntVec(probesStr, ',', probes);
00428   if (probes.size() != numProbes) {
00429     Err::errAbort("Probeset: '" + name + "' on line: " + ToStr(lineNumber) +
00430                   " expecting " + ToStr(numProbes) + " probes got " + ToStr(probes.size()));
00431   }
00432   if (probes.size() % numMatch != 0) {
00433     Err::errAbort("Probeset: '" + name + "' on line: " + ToStr(lineNumber) +
00434                   " must have an integral number * numMatch count of probes.");
00435   }
00436 
00437   // Subtract 1 of probes as we use R type 1 based index externally
00438   for (int pIx = 0; pIx < probes.size(); pIx++) {
00439     if (probes[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe) {
00440       probes[pIx]--;
00441     }
00442     // check to make sure that we got a reasonable probe index
00443     if (probes[pIx] > maxId ||
00444        (probes[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe && probes[pIx] < 0)) {
00445       Err::errAbort("Probeset: '" + name + "' on line: " + ToStr(lineNumber) +
00446                     " expecting all probes to be greater than 0 and less than " + ToStr(maxId) +
00447                     ". got: " + ToStr(probes[pIx]));
00448     }
00449   }
00450   /* Remember the type in case this probeset isn't actually
00451      loaded. Convert type to expression if a "false" genotype
00452      probeset. */
00453   // Ray added this to cover up a later hack.
00454   /*
00455     if (m_PsTypes.empty()) {
00456     if (type == ProbeSet::GenoType && numBlocks != 2 && numBlocks != 4) {
00457     m_PsTypes.push_back((char)ProbeSet::Expression);
00458     }
00459     else {
00460     m_PsTypes.push_back((char)type);
00461     }
00462     }
00463   */
00464   bool multAlleles = ! ChipLayout::sameValues(blockAlleles);
00465   trackGlobalStats(name, type, numBlocks, blockSizes, numMatch, probes, multAlleles);
00466 
00467   if (keepOrder) {
00468     // mark probes to be loaded.
00469     for (int pIx = 0; pIx < probes.size(); pIx++) {
00470       m_ProbeLayoutOrder.push_back(probes[pIx]);
00471     }
00472   }
00473   
00474   if (keep) {
00475     for (int pIx = 0; pIx < probes.size(); pIx++) {
00476       if (probes[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe) {
00477         probeSubSet[probes[pIx]] = true;
00478       }
00479     }
00480     // save probeset
00481     ProbeListPacked pl = makeProbeListPacked(name, type, numBlocks, blockSizes,
00482                                              blockAnns,
00483                                              blockAlleles,
00484                                              blockContexts,
00485                                              blockChannels,
00486                                              blockRepTypes,
00487                                              numMatch, numProbes, probes);
00488     // we are using the vec in the factory.
00489     // m_PlVec.push_back(pl);
00490   }
00491 }
00492 
00493 ////////////////////
00494 
00495 void checkTsvChipType(affx::TsvFile& tsv,const std::string& chipType)
00496 {
00497   // blank chipType matches all...
00498   if (chipType=="") {
00499     return;
00500   }
00501 
00502   // found a match!
00503   if (tsv.hasHeaderEqualTo("chip_type",chipType)==affx::TSV_OK) {
00504     return;
00505   }
00506 
00507   //// didnt find a match tell the user why...
00508   //  no header...
00509   std::string val;
00510   if (tsv.getHeader("chip_type", val)!=TSV_OK) {
00511     Err::errAbort("chip_type is a required header in file: '"+tsv.getFileName()+"'");
00512   }
00513   // there was a mismatch...
00514   Verbose::out(1,"This file supports the following:");
00515   tsv.headersBegin();
00516   while (tsv.headersFindNext("chip_type",val)==TSV_OK) {
00517     Verbose::out(1,"   #%chip_type="+val);
00518   }
00519   // signal the error
00520   Err::errAbort("No match for chip_type='"+chipType+"' in '"+tsv.getFileName()+"'");
00521 }
00522 
00523 /**
00524  * Read in probelist data from a simple probe format file.
00525  *
00526  * @param fileName - Name of file to be opened.
00527  * @param probeSetsToLoad - Which probe sets should be loaded?
00528  * @param probesetNames - If not null filled in with the
00529  * probesetname for each probeset even if not actually into
00530  * chiplayout. Useful for chp files where every single probeset must
00531  * be included and in order.
00532  * @param probeSubset - Subset of probes to be loaded.
00533  * @param chipTypeExpected - What sort of chip should this cdf file be for?
00534  * @param justStats - just read and generate stats, don't load into memory.
00535  * @param psTypesToLoad - What types of probesets to load into memory.
00536  */
00537 void ChipLayout::openSpf(const std::string& fileName,
00538                          const std::set<const char *, 
00539                          Util::ltstr> &probeSetsToLoad,
00540                          std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
00541                          std::vector<bool> &probeSubSet,
00542                          const std::string &chipTypeExpected,
00543                          bool justStats,
00544                          std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> &psTypesToLoad) {
00545 
00546   // what format is this spf file?
00547   std::string spf_format;
00548 
00549   // open and close the file to take a a peek at the format.
00550   SpfFile tmp_spf;
00551   if (tmp_spf.openSpf(fileName)!=affx::TSV_OK) {
00552     APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to open spf file '"+fileName+"'");
00553   }
00554   tmp_spf.close();
00555 
00556   if (tmp_spf.m_spf_format==0) {
00557     APT_ERR_ABORT("Unknown spf file format. (format="+ToStr(tmp_spf.m_spf_format)+")");
00558   }
00559 
00560   // v3?
00561   if (tmp_spf.m_spf_format==4) {
00562     openSpf_v4(fileName,
00563                probeSetsToLoad,
00564                probesetNames,
00565                probeSubSet,
00566                chipTypeExpected,
00567                justStats,
00568                psTypesToLoad);
00569     return;
00570   }
00571   if (tmp_spf.m_spf_format==3) {
00572     openSpf_v3(fileName,
00573                probeSetsToLoad,
00574                probesetNames,
00575                probeSubSet,
00576                chipTypeExpected,
00577                justStats,
00578                psTypesToLoad);
00579     return;
00580   }
00581 
00582   // anything else (none,"1","2") is considered to be "classic"
00583   openSpf_v2(fileName,
00584              probeSetsToLoad,
00585              probesetNames,
00586              probeSubSet,
00587              chipTypeExpected,
00588              justStats,
00589              psTypesToLoad);
00590 }
00591 
00592 void ChipLayout::openSpf_v2(const std::string& fileName,
00593                             const std::set<const char *, 
00594                             Util::ltstr> &probeSetsToLoad,
00595                             std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
00596                             std::vector<bool> &probeSubSet,
00597                             const std::string &chipTypeExpected,
00598                             bool justStats,
00599                             std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> &psTypesToLoad)
00600 {
00601   string chipType;
00602   int expectedProbesets = 0, seenProbesets = 0;
00603   int tmp_X;
00604   int tmp_Y;
00605 
00606   //
00607   m_haveKillList = false;
00608 
00609   if (m_SpfFile.openSpf(fileName) != TSV_OK) {
00610     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open " + ToStr(fileName) + " to read.");
00611   }
00612   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_SpfFile.m_spf_format==2,"missing required v2 columns.");
00613 
00614   // errors if no match
00615   checkTsvChipType(m_SpfFile,chipTypeExpected);
00616   // @todo this data is already in "m_SpfFile.m_header_*"
00617   //
00618   if (m_SpfFile.getHeader("num-probesets", expectedProbesets) != TSV_OK) {
00619     Err::errAbort("num-probesets is a required field in file: '" + ToStr(fileName) + "'");
00620   }
00621   // @todo This should come from the spf object, not reading the header again.
00622   m_SpfFile.getHeader("num-channels", m_numChannels);
00623   //
00624   if (m_SpfFile.getHeader("num-cols",tmp_X) != TSV_OK) {
00625     Err::errAbort("num-cols is a required field in file: '" + ToStr(fileName) + "'");
00626   }
00627   if (m_SpfFile.getHeader("num-rows", tmp_Y) != TSV_OK) {
00628     Err::errAbort("num-rows is a required field in file: '" + ToStr(fileName) + "'");
00629   }
00630   setDimensions(tmp_X,tmp_Y);
00631   //
00632   resizeStats(getProbeCount());
00633   //
00634   if (probeSubSet.empty()) {
00635     probeSubSet.resize(m_XCount * m_YCount, false);
00636   }
00637 
00638   string name, blockSizesStr, blockAnnsStr, blockAlleleStr, blockContextStr, blockChannelStr, blockRepTypeStr, probesStr;
00639   int type = -1, numBlocks = -1, numMatch = -1, numProbes = -1;
00640 
00641   m_SpfFile.bind(0, "name", &name, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00642   m_SpfFile.bind(0, "type", &type, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00643   m_SpfFile.bind(0, "num_blocks", &numBlocks, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00644   m_SpfFile.bind(0, "block_sizes", &blockSizesStr, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00645   m_SpfFile.bind(0, "block_annotations", &blockAnnsStr, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00646   m_SpfFile.bind(0, "num_match", &numMatch, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00647   m_SpfFile.bind(0, "num_probes", &numProbes, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00648   m_SpfFile.bind(0, "probes", &probesStr, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00649 
00650   // optional columns
00651   if (m_SpfFile.m_v2_block_alleles_cidx>=0) {
00652     m_SpfFile.bind(0,m_SpfFile.m_v2_block_alleles_cidx,&blockAlleleStr,affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00653   }
00654   if (m_SpfFile.m_v2_block_contexts_cidx>=0) {
00655     m_SpfFile.bind(0,m_SpfFile.m_v2_block_contexts_cidx,&blockContextStr,affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00656   }
00657   if (m_SpfFile.m_v2_block_channels_cidx>=0) {
00658     m_SpfFile.bind(0,m_SpfFile.m_v2_block_channels_cidx,&blockChannelStr,affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00659   }
00660   if (m_SpfFile.m_v2_block_rep_types_cidx>=0) {
00661     m_SpfFile.bind(0,m_SpfFile.m_v2_block_rep_types_cidx,&blockRepTypeStr,affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00662   }
00663 
00664   std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr>::const_iterator emptyIter = probeSetsToLoad.end();
00665   vector<string> words;
00666   unsigned int dotMod = max(expectedProbesets/40,1);
00667   Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Reading " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets", 40, dotMod, expectedProbesets);
00668   while (m_SpfFile.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00669     Verbose::progressStep(1);
00670     bool keep = true;
00671     seenProbesets++;
00672     // pretend like they aren't even there if have specific types to load
00673     if (!psTypesToLoad.empty() && 
00674         psTypesToLoad.find((affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType)type) == psTypesToLoad.end()) {
00675       continue;
00676     }
00677     if (probesetNames != NULL) {
00678       probesetNames->push_back(Util::cloneString(name.c_str()));
00679     }
00680     bool keepOrder = true;
00681     if (justStats)
00682       keep = false;
00683     if (!probeSetsToLoad.empty() && 
00684         probeSetsToLoad.find(name.c_str()) == emptyIter) {
00685       keep = false;
00686       keepOrder = false;
00687     }
00688 
00689     parseProbeListRecord(name, type, numBlocks, 
00690                          blockSizesStr, 
00691                          blockAnnsStr,
00692                          (m_SpfFile.m_v2_block_alleles_cidx>=0),
00693                          blockAlleleStr,
00694                          (m_SpfFile.m_v2_block_contexts_cidx>=0),
00695                          blockContextStr,
00696                          (m_SpfFile.m_v2_block_channels_cidx>=0),
00697                          blockChannelStr,
00698                          (m_SpfFile.m_v2_block_rep_types_cidx>=0),
00699                          blockRepTypeStr,
00700                          numMatch, numProbes, 
00701                          probesStr, 
00702                          m_SpfFile.lineNumber(), keep, probeSubSet, keepOrder);
00703   }
00704 
00705   //
00706   m_SpfFile.close();
00707   Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00708   
00709   if (seenProbesets != expectedProbesets) {
00710     Err::errAbort("Expecting: " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets in file: '" +
00711                   ToStr(fileName) + "' got: " + ToStr(seenProbesets));
00712   }
00713   if (!justStats) {
00714     makePsMaps();
00715   }
00716 }
00717 
00718 void ChipLayout::openSpf_v3(const std::string& fileName,
00719                             const std::set<const char *, 
00720                             Util::ltstr> &probeSetsToLoad,
00721                             std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
00722                             std::vector<bool> &probeSubSet,
00723                             const std::string& chipTypeExpected,
00724                             bool justStats,
00725                             std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> &psTypesToLoad) {
00726   //
00727   string chipType;
00728   int xCount = 0, yCount = 0;
00729   int expectedProbesets = 0;
00730   //int seenProbesets = 0;
00731   //bool chipTypeOk = false;
00732   bool keep;
00733 
00734   //
00735   // m_PlVec.clear();
00736   m_haveKillList = false;
00737 
00738   //
00739   if (m_SpfFile.openSpf(fileName) != TSV_OK) {
00740     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open " + ToStr(fileName) + " to read.");
00741   }
00742   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_SpfFile.m_spf_format==3,"missing required v3 columns.");
00743 
00744   //if (m_SpfFile.hasHeaderEqualTo("spf-format","3")!=TSV_OK) {
00745   //Err::errAbort("header 'spf-format'!=3 in '" + ToStr(fileName) + "'");
00746   //}
00747 
00748   checkTsvChipType(m_SpfFile,chipType);
00749 
00750   //
00751   if (m_SpfFile.getHeader("num-cols", xCount)!=TSV_OK) {
00752     Err::errAbort("num-cols is a required field in file: '" + ToStr(fileName) + "'");
00753   }
00754   if (m_SpfFile.getHeader("num-rows", yCount)!=TSV_OK) {
00755     Err::errAbort("num-rows is a required field in file: '" + ToStr(fileName) + "'");
00756   }
00757   setDimensions(xCount,yCount);
00758   //
00759   if (m_SpfFile.getHeader("num-probesets", expectedProbesets)!=TSV_OK) {
00760     Err::errAbort("num-probesets is a required field in file: '" + ToStr(fileName) + "'");
00761   }
00762   //
00763   resizeStats(m_XCount * m_YCount);
00764   if (probeSubSet.empty()) {
00765     probeSubSet.resize(m_XCount * m_YCount, false);
00766   }
00767   
00768   std::string i_name;
00769   int i_type;
00770   int i_annotation;
00771   int i_allele_code;
00772   int i_context_code;
00773   int i_probe_id;
00774 
00775   std::vector<int> block_size_vec;
00776   std::vector<int> block_annotation_vec;
00777   std::vector<int> block_allele_vec;
00778   std::vector<int> block_context_vec;
00779   std::vector<int> block_channel_vec;
00780   std::vector<int> block_rep_type_vec;
00781   std::vector<int> probe_ids_vec;
00782   int probe_cnt;
00783 
00784   // 0: name type
00785   unsigned int dotMod = max(expectedProbesets/40,1);
00786   unsigned int seenProbesets = 0;
00787   Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Reading " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets", 40, dotMod, expectedProbesets);
00788   while (m_SpfFile.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
00789     Verbose::progressStep(1);
00790     seenProbesets++;
00791     // clear accum block info...
00792     block_size_vec.resize(0);
00793     block_annotation_vec.resize(0);
00794     block_allele_vec.resize(0);
00795     block_context_vec.resize(0);
00796     block_channel_vec.resize(0);
00797     block_rep_type_vec.resize(0);
00798     probe_ids_vec.resize(0);
00799 
00800     //
00801     if ((m_SpfFile.get(0,"name",i_name)!=TSV_OK) || (i_name=="")) {
00802       Err::errAbort("No name");
00803     }
00804     if (m_SpfFile.get(0,"type",i_type)!=TSV_OK) {
00805       Err::errAbort("No type");
00806     }
00807     // pretend like they aren't even there if we have specific types to load.
00808     if ((!psTypesToLoad.empty()) && 
00809         (psTypesToLoad.find((affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType)i_type) == psTypesToLoad.end())) {
00810       continue;
00811     }
00812     
00813     // 1: allele allele_code
00814     while (m_SpfFile.nextLevel(1)==TSV_OK) {
00815       m_SpfFile.get(1,"allele_code",i_allele_code);
00816       
00817       // 2: context context_code
00818       while (m_SpfFile.nextLevel(2)==TSV_OK) {
00819         m_SpfFile.get(2,"context_code",i_context_code);
00820         m_SpfFile.get(2,"annotation",i_annotation);
00821 
00822         // 3: probe_id
00823         probe_cnt=0;
00824         while (m_SpfFile.nextLevel(3)==TSV_OK) {
00825           m_SpfFile.get(3,"probe_id",i_probe_id);
00826           probe_ids_vec.push_back(i_probe_id);
00827           probe_cnt++;
00828         }
00829         // record block info
00830         block_allele_vec.push_back(i_allele_code);
00831         block_annotation_vec.push_back(i_annotation);
00832         block_context_vec.push_back(i_context_code);
00833         block_size_vec.push_back(probe_cnt);
00834         block_channel_vec.push_back(0);
00835         block_rep_type_vec.push_back(0);
00836       }
00837     }
00838 
00839     // like readProbeListRecord, but we have things in vector form already.
00840 
00841     // adjust the probe_ids from 1-based to 0-based
00842     for (int i=0;i<probe_ids_vec.size();i++) {
00843       if (probe_ids_vec[i]!=ProbeList::null_probe) {
00844         probe_ids_vec[i]--;
00845       }
00846       // add it to the list
00847       m_ProbeLayoutOrder.push_back(probe_ids_vec[i]);
00848     }
00849     
00850     //
00851     if (probesetNames != NULL) {
00852       probesetNames->push_back(Util::cloneString(i_name.c_str()));
00853     }
00854     bool multAlleles = ! ChipLayout::sameValues(block_allele_vec);
00855     trackGlobalStats(i_name,i_type, 
00856                      block_size_vec.size(), block_size_vec, 
00857                      probe_ids_vec.size(), probe_ids_vec, multAlleles);
00858     //
00859     keep=true;
00860     if (justStats) {
00861       keep=false;
00862     }
00863     else if ((!probeSetsToLoad.empty()) && 
00864              (probeSetsToLoad.find(i_name.c_str()) == probeSetsToLoad.end())) {
00865       keep=false;
00866     }
00867 
00868     if (keep) {
00869       // mark probes to be loaded.
00870       for (int pIx = 0; pIx < probe_ids_vec.size(); pIx++) {
00871         if (probe_ids_vec[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe) {
00872           probeSubSet[probe_ids_vec[pIx]] = true;
00873         }
00874       }
00875       
00876       // process the probeset we just read...
00877       ProbeListPacked pl = makeProbeListPacked(i_name, i_type, 
00878                                                block_size_vec.size(), 
00879                                                block_size_vec,
00880                                                block_annotation_vec,
00881                                                block_allele_vec,
00882                                                block_context_vec,
00883                                                block_channel_vec,
00884                                                block_rep_type_vec,
00885                                                1,
00886                                                ///@todo AW bug? probe_ids_vec.size(), // numMatch,
00887                                                probe_ids_vec.size(), // numProbes, 
00888                                                probe_ids_vec);
00889       //m_PlVec.push_back(pl);
00890     }
00891   } // allele
00892 
00893   //
00894   m_SpfFile.close();
00895   Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00896 
00897   if (seenProbesets != expectedProbesets) {
00898     Err::errAbort("Expecting: " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets in file: '" +
00899                   ToStr(fileName) + "' got: " + ToStr(seenProbesets));
00900   }
00901     
00902   if (!justStats) {
00903     makePsMaps();
00904   }
00905 }
00906 
00907 void ChipLayout::openSpf_v4(const std::string& fileName,
00908                             const std::set<const char *, 
00909                             Util::ltstr> &probeSetsToLoad,
00910                             std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
00911                             std::vector<bool> &probeSubSet,
00912                             const std::string& chipTypeExpected,
00913                             bool justStats,
00914                             std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> &psTypesToLoad)
00915 {
00916   //
00917   string chipType;
00918   int xCount = 0, yCount = 0;
00919   int expectedProbesets = 0;
00920   //int seenProbesets = 0;
00921   //bool chipTypeOk = false;
00922   bool keep;
00923   //
00924   // m_PlVec.clear();
00925   m_haveKillList = false;
00926 
00927   //
00928   if (m_SpfFile.openSpf(fileName) != TSV_OK) {
00929     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open " + ToStr(fileName) + " to read.");
00930   }
00931   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_SpfFile.m_spf_format==4,"missing required v4 columns.");
00932   //if (m_SpfFile.hasHeaderEqualTo("spf-format","4")!=TSV_OK) {
00933   //Err::errAbort("header 'spf-format'!=4 in '" + ToStr(fileName) + "'");
00934   //}
00935 
00936   checkTsvChipType(m_SpfFile,chipType);
00937 
00938   //
00939   if (m_SpfFile.getHeader("num-cols", xCount)!=TSV_OK) {
00940     Err::errAbort("num-cols is a required field in file: '" + ToStr(fileName) + "'");
00941   }
00942   if (m_SpfFile.getHeader("num-rows", yCount)!=TSV_OK) {
00943     Err::errAbort("num-rows is a required field in file: '" + ToStr(fileName) + "'");
00944   }
00945   setDimensions(xCount,yCount);
00946   //
00947   // @todo This should come from the spf object, not reading the header again.
00948   m_SpfFile.getHeader("num-channels", m_numChannels);
00949   //
00950   if (m_SpfFile.getHeader("num-probesets", expectedProbesets)!=TSV_OK) {
00951     Err::errAbort("num-probesets is a required field in file: '" + ToStr(fileName) + "'");
00952   }
00953   //
00954   resizeStats(m_XCount * m_YCount);
00955   if (probeSubSet.empty()) {
00956     probeSubSet.resize(m_XCount * m_YCount, false);
00957   }
00958   
00959   std::string i_name;
00960   int i_type;
00961   int i_annotation_code;
00962   int i_allele_code;
00963   int i_context_code;
00964   int i_channel_code;
00965   int i_rep_type;
00966   int i_probe_id;
00967 
00968   std::vector<int> block_size_vec;
00969   std::vector<int> block_annotation_vec;
00970   std::vector<int> block_allele_vec;
00971   std::vector<int> block_context_vec;
00972   std::vector<int> block_channel_vec;
00973   std::vector<int> block_rep_type_vec;
00974   std::vector<int> probe_ids_vec;
00975   int block_probe_cnt;
00976 
00977   // 0: name type
00978   unsigned int dotMod = max(expectedProbesets/40,1);
00979   unsigned int seenProbesets = 0;
00980   Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Reading " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets", 40, dotMod, expectedProbesets);
00981 
00982   while (m_SpfFile.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
00983     Verbose::progressStep(1);
00984     seenProbesets++;
00985     // clear block info...
00986     i_name="";
00987     i_type=0;
00988     block_size_vec.resize(0);
00989     block_annotation_vec.resize(0);
00990     block_allele_vec.resize(0);
00991     block_context_vec.resize(0);
00992     block_channel_vec.resize(0);
00993     block_rep_type_vec.resize(0);
00994     probe_ids_vec.resize(0);
00995 
00996     // ray added this to fill out the vector.
00997     // we dont need to do this anymore as ChipLayout::getProbeSetType()
00998     // gets it from the factory and modifies the return value.
00999     // m_PsTypes.push_back(ProbeSet::Marker);
01000     
01001     //
01002     if ((m_SpfFile.get(0,"name",i_name)!=TSV_OK) || (i_name=="")) {
01003       Err::errAbort("No name");
01004     }
01005     if (m_SpfFile.get(0,"type",i_type)!=TSV_OK) {
01006       Err::errAbort("No type");
01007     }
01008 
01009     // 1: block annotation allele
01010     while (m_SpfFile.nextLevel(1)==TSV_OK) {
01011       // These should be ProbeList::UNSET
01012       i_annotation_code=0;
01013       i_allele_code=0;
01014       i_context_code=0;
01015       i_channel_code=0;
01016       i_rep_type=0;
01017       //
01018       m_SpfFile.get(1,m_SpfFile.m_v4_annotation_code_cidx,i_annotation_code);
01019       m_SpfFile.get(1,m_SpfFile.m_v4_allele_code_cidx,i_allele_code);
01020       m_SpfFile.get(1,m_SpfFile.m_v4_context_code_cidx,i_context_code);
01021       m_SpfFile.get(1,m_SpfFile.m_v4_channel_code_cidx,i_channel_code);
01022       m_SpfFile.get(1,m_SpfFile.m_v4_rep_type_cidx,i_rep_type);
01023       
01024       // 2: probe_id
01025       block_probe_cnt=0;
01026       while (m_SpfFile.nextLevel(2)==TSV_OK) {
01027         i_probe_id=-1;
01028         m_SpfFile.get(2,m_SpfFile.m_v4_probe_id_cidx,i_probe_id);
01029         probe_ids_vec.push_back(i_probe_id);
01030         block_probe_cnt++;
01031       }
01032 
01033       // record block info
01034       block_size_vec.push_back(block_probe_cnt);
01035       block_annotation_vec.push_back(i_annotation_code);
01036       block_allele_vec.push_back(i_allele_code);
01037       block_context_vec.push_back(i_context_code);
01038       block_channel_vec.push_back(i_channel_code);
01039       block_rep_type_vec.push_back(i_rep_type);
01040     } // while blocks
01041 
01042     // adjust the probe_ids from 1-based to 0-based
01043     for (int i=0;i<probe_ids_vec.size();i++) {
01044       if (probe_ids_vec[i]!=ProbeList::null_probe) {
01045         probe_ids_vec[i]--;
01046       }
01047       // add it to the list
01048       m_ProbeLayoutOrder.push_back(probe_ids_vec[i]);
01049     }
01050 
01051     // pretend like they aren't even there if we have specific types to load.
01052     if ((!psTypesToLoad.empty()) && 
01053         (psTypesToLoad.find((affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType)i_type) == psTypesToLoad.end())) {
01054       continue;
01055     }
01056 
01057     //
01058     bool multAlleles = ! ChipLayout::sameValues(block_allele_vec);
01059     trackGlobalStats(i_name,i_type, 
01060                      block_size_vec.size(), 
01061                      block_size_vec,
01062                      probe_ids_vec.size(), 
01063                      probe_ids_vec,
01064                      multAlleles);
01065     //
01066     if (probesetNames != NULL) {
01067       probesetNames->push_back(Util::cloneString(i_name.c_str()));
01068     }
01069     
01070     //
01071     keep=true;
01072     if (justStats) {
01073       keep=false;
01074     }
01075     else if ((!probeSetsToLoad.empty()) && 
01076              (probeSetsToLoad.find(i_name.c_str()) == probeSetsToLoad.end())) {
01077       keep=false;
01078     }
01079     
01080     if (keep) {
01081       // mark probes to be loaded.
01082       for (int pIx = 0; pIx < probe_ids_vec.size(); pIx++) {
01083         if (probe_ids_vec[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe) {
01084           probeSubSet[probe_ids_vec[pIx]] = true;
01085         }
01086       }
01087       
01088       // process the probeset we just read...
01089       ProbeListPacked pl = makeProbeListPacked(i_name, i_type, 
01090                                                block_size_vec.size(), 
01091                                                block_size_vec,
01092                                                block_annotation_vec,
01093                                                block_allele_vec,
01094                                                block_context_vec,
01095                                                block_channel_vec,
01096                                                block_rep_type_vec,
01097                                                1,
01098                                                ///@todo AW bug? probe_ids_vec.size(), // numMatch,
01099                                                probe_ids_vec.size(), // numProbes, 
01100                                                probe_ids_vec);
01101     }
01102   } // while probesets
01103 
01104   //
01105   m_SpfFile.close();
01106   Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
01107 
01108   if (seenProbesets != expectedProbesets) {
01109     Err::errAbort("Expecting: " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets in file: '" +
01110                   ToStr(fileName) + "' got: " + ToStr(seenProbesets));
01111   }
01112   
01113   if (!justStats) {
01114     makePsMaps();
01115   }
01116 }

01120 }

01122 //    return m_PlVec[index];

01188 /**
01189  * Open and parse out the data of a file.
01190  * @param fileName - Name of PGF file to be opened.
01191  * @param xSize - How many features in x dimension.
01192  * @param ySize - How many features in y dimension.
01193  * @param probeSetsToLoad - Vector of probe set ids to be loaded.
01194  * @param probeSubset - Subset of probes to be loaded.
01195  * @param chipType - What sort of chip should this pgf file be for?
01196  * @return bool - true if successful.
01197  */
01198 bool ChipLayout::openPgf(const std::string& fileName,
01199                          unsigned int xSize, unsigned int ySize,
01200                          const std::set<const char *, 
01201                          Util::ltstr> &probeSetsToLoad,
01202                          std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
01203                          std::vector<const char *> *probesetDisplayNames,
01204                          std::vector<bool> &probeSubset,
01205                          const std::string &chipType,
01206                          probeidmap_t &killList,
01207                          bool justStats, 
01208                          bool doPList)
01209 {
01210   // this was a member var (m_Pgf), now it is just a var.
01211   affx::PgfFile pgf;
01212   pgf.close();
01213 
01214   int rc = pgf.open(fileName);
01215   if (rc != TSV_OK) {
01216     Err::errAbort("ChipLayout::openPgf() - Couldn't open pgf file: '" + fileName + "'");
01217   }
01218 
01219   if (!killList.empty())
01220     m_haveKillList = true;
01221 
01222   // Check that we match one of the chip_types in the file.
01223   /// @todo  move this into PgfFile.h
01224   bool chipTypeOk = false;
01225   std::string tmpChipType;
01226 
01227   pgf.m_tsv.headersBegin();
01228   if (chipType!="") {
01229     while ((!chipTypeOk)&&
01230            (pgf.m_tsv.headersFindNext("chip_type",tmpChipType)==TSV_OK)) {
01231       if (tmpChipType==chipType) {
01232         chipTypeOk=true;
01233       }
01234     }
01235     if (!chipTypeOk) {
01236       Err::errAbort("In file '" + ToStr(fileName) + "' does not support chip type: " + chipType);
01237       return false;
01238     }
01239   }
01240 
01241   // Copy the header values to the layout.
01242   // it will use them while printing.
01243   std::string key;
01244   std::string val;
01245   pgf.m_tsv.headersBegin();
01246   while (pgf.m_tsv.headersNext(key,val)==TSV_OK) {
01247     if (key == "probeset_count") {
01248       m_ProbeCounts.reserve(Convert::toInt(val.c_str()));
01249     }
01250     m_Header[key].push_back(val);
01251   }
01252   setDimensions(xSize,ySize);
01253   // do the actual data suck
01254   unsigned int numProbes = m_XCount * m_YCount;
01255   //  if (doPList)
01256   if (m_SpfFileName != "") {
01257     openSpfForWrite(m_SpfFile,m_SpfFileName);
01258   }
01259   readProbeListPgfFileKillList(pgf, numProbes, m_PlFactory, probeSetsToLoad,
01260                                probesetNames, probesetDisplayNames, probeSubset, killList, justStats);
01261   pgf.close();
01262   if (!justStats)
01263     makePsMaps();
01264   Verbose::out(2, "Loaded " + ToStr(getProbeSetCount()) + " probe sets.");
01265   if (m_SpfFile.is_open())
01266     m_SpfFile.close();
01267   return true;
01268 }
