01271 //{
01272 //      if (i == 3934539) return true;
01273 //      if (i ==  538928) return true;
01274 //      if (i == 1469074) return true;
01275 //      if (i ==  619599) return true;
01276 //      if (i == 1495980) return true;
01277 //      if (i == 4896938) return true;
01278 //      if (i == 2056288) return true;
01279 //      if (i ==  818179) return true;
01280 //
01281 //      return false;
01282 //}
01283 
01284 /**
01285  * Read the contents of rowFile into a vector of
01286  * probe sets.
01287  * @param pgf - Opened Pgf file to read from
01288  * @param numProbes - How many probes are on this chip?
01289  * @param psVec - vector to be filled in.
01290  * @param probeSetsToLoad - Vector of probe set ids to be loaded.
01291  * @param probeSubset - Subset of probes to be loaded.
01292  * @param killList - List of probes not to be used.
01293  */
01294 void ChipLayout::readProbeListPgfFileKillList(affx::PgfFile &pgf,
01295                                               unsigned int numProbes,
01296                                               //std::vector<ProbeListPacked> &plVec,
01297                                               ProbeListFactory &plFactory,
01298                                               const std::set<const char *, 
01299                                               Util::ltstr> &probeSetsToLoad,
01300                                               std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
01301                                               std::vector<const char *> *probesetDisplayNames,
01302                                               std::vector<bool> &probeSubset,
01303                                               probeidmap_t &killList,
01304                                               bool justStats) {
01305   bool probeSetsToLoad_empty=probeSetsToLoad.empty();
01306   set<const char *, Util::ltstr>::const_iterator probeSetsToLoad_iter;
01307   bool keepProbeSet;
01308 
01309   // If probeset count is set, us it to display progress info
01310   int expectedProbesets = -1;
01311   pgf.m_tsv.getHeader("probesets",expectedProbesets);
01312 
01313   string val;
01314   if (pgf.m_tsv.headersFindNext("probesets",val)==TSV_OK){
01315     expectedProbesets = Convert::toInt(val.c_str());
01316   }
01317 
01318   // skip to the start of the data
01319   pgf.rewind();
01320   // m_PmProbes is a bitmask of which probes are PM.  (pm=true)
01321   resizeStats(numProbes);
01322 
01323   // Set up some local static storage. Once a probeset is determined
01324   // to be kept we will allocate memory on the heap for it. Trying to
01325   // prevent lots of new and deletes as they can fragement memory.
01326   ProbeSet psConst;
01327   int psConstMaxName = 256;
01328   psConst.name = new char[psConstMaxName];
01329   psConst.name[psConstMaxName -1] = '\0'; // null terminate.
01330   vector<Atom> *locAtoms = new vector<Atom>(MAX_ATOMS);
01331   vector<Probe> *locProbes = new vector<Probe>(MAX_PROBES);
01332   // gobble up probesets
01333   string tempName;
01334   unsigned int dotMod = max(expectedProbesets/40,1);
01335   if (expectedProbesets > 0)
01336     Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Reading " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets", 40, dotMod, expectedProbesets);
01337   unsigned int seenProbesets = 0;
01338   while (pgf.next_probeset()==TSV_OK) {
01339     if (expectedProbesets > 0)
01340       Verbose::progressStep(1);
01341     seenProbesets++;
01342     //clearProbeSet(psConst); // redundant.
01343     int pmProbeCount = 0;
01344     int pmProbePossible = 0;
01345     clearProbeSet(psConst);
01346 
01347     // it is always this (for now I guess -jhg)
01348     psConst.psType = ProbeSet::Expression;
01349 
01350     // copy the data over
01351         tempName = ToStr(pgf.probeset_id);
01352     if (tempName.size() + 1 >= psConstMaxName) {
01353       delete[] psConst.name;
01354       psConst.name = new char[tempName.size() + 1];
01355       psConstMaxName = tempName.size() + 1;
01356       psConst.name[psConstMaxName -1] = '\0'; // make sure always null terminated
01357     }
01358     strncpy(psConst.name, tempName.c_str(), psConstMaxName -1);
01359 
01360     // do we want to keep this probeset?
01361     keepProbeSet=true; // yes unless...
01362     if (!probeSetsToLoad_empty) {
01363       probeSetsToLoad_iter=probeSetsToLoad.find(psConst.name);
01364       if (probeSetsToLoad_iter==probeSetsToLoad.end()) {
01365         keepProbeSet=false;
01366       }
01367     }
01368     set<probeid_t> probesSeen;
01369     set<atomid_t> atomsSeen;
01370     set<probeid_t>::iterator seenIter;
01371 
01372     int locAtomIndex = 0;
01373     int locProbeIndex = 0;
01374     while (pgf.next_atom()==TSV_OK) {
01375       bool lastPmDropped = false;
01376       int atomProbeIndex = locProbeIndex;
01377       if (locAtomIndex + 1 > locAtoms->size()) {
01378         Verbose::out(2, "Resizing atom size from: " + ToStr(locAtoms->size()) + " to " + ToStr(locAtoms->size() + MAX_ATOMS));
01379         resizeAtoms(&locAtoms, locAtoms->size() + MAX_ATOMS, &psConst);
01380       }
01381       Atom *atom = &(*locAtoms)[locAtomIndex++];
01382       // copy over data
01383       atom->id = pgf.atom_id;
01384       // check to make sure we haven't seen this atom in this probeset before...
01385       if (atomsSeen.find(atom->id) != atomsSeen.end())
01386         Err::errAbort("Duplicate atom ids (" + ToStr(atom->id) + ") in probeset : " + ToStr(psConst.name));
01387       else
01388         atomsSeen.insert(atom->id);
01389       while (pgf.next_probe()==TSV_OK) {
01390         probeidmap_t::iterator iter;
01391 
01392         // If current probes are greater than local storage have to increase.
01393         if (locProbeIndex + 1 > locProbes->size()) {
01394           Verbose::out(2, "Resizing probe pm/mm size from: " + ToStr(locProbes->size()) + " to " +
01395                        ToStr(locProbes->size() + MAX_PROBES));
01396           resizeProbes(&locProbes, locProbes->size() + MAX_PROBES, locAtoms, locAtomIndex);
01397         }
01398         Probe *probe = &(*locProbes)[locProbeIndex++];
01399         // copy over data
01400         probe->id=pgf.probe_id;
01401         // check to make sure we haven't seen this probe in this probeset before...
01402         if (probesSeen.find(probe->id) != probesSeen.end())
01403           Err::errAbort("Duplicate probe ids (" + ToStr(probe->id) + ") in probeset : " + ToStr(psConst.name));
01404         else
01405           probesSeen.insert(probe->id);
01406         probe->type=Probe::typeForString(pgf.probe_type.c_str());
01407         if (pgf.gc_count >= NULLPROBEGC) {
01408           Verbose::out(1,"GC count, " + ToStr(pgf.gc_count) + ", exceeds software limit of " + ToStr(NULLPROBEGC - 1) + ". Ignoring.");
01409           probe->gcCount = (char)NULLPROBEGC;
01410         } else if (pgf.gc_count == -1) {
01411           probe->gcCount = (char)NULLPROBEGC;
01412         } else {
01413           probe->gcCount = (char)pgf.gc_count;
01414         }
01415         probe->id--; // Alan created pgf files 1-based, we want zero based.
01416 
01417         if (Probe::isPm(*probe))
01418           pmProbePossible++;
01419 
01420         if (inKillList((probeid_t)probe->id+1, psConst.name, killList)) {
01421           Verbose::out(4,"Ignoring probe " + ToStr(probe->id+1) + " in probeset " + ToStr(psConst.name) + " due to kill list");
01422           if (Probe::isPm(*probe)) {
01423             lastPmDropped = true;
01424           }
01425           clearProbe(*probe);
01426           locProbeIndex--;
01427         }
01428         // Did we exclude this probe's matching PM last time?
01429         else if (lastPmDropped && Probe::isMm(*probe)) {
01430           Verbose::out(4,"Ignoring MM probe " + ToStr(probe->id+1) + " in probeset " + ToStr(psConst.name) + " due to PM in kill list");
01431           clearProbe(*probe);
01432           locProbeIndex--;
01433           lastPmDropped = false;
01434         }
01435         // treat it like a normal probe.
01436         else {
01437           // if this probeset contains a probe to be kept
01438           // make sure to keep the probeset around
01439           if (probe->type == Probe::PMAT || probe->type == Probe::PMST) {
01440             pmProbeCount++;
01441           }
01442           //   atom->probes.push_back(probe);
01443           lastPmDropped = false;
01444         }
01445       } // probe
01446       atom->probes.resize(locProbeIndex - atomProbeIndex);
01447       for (uint32_t pIx = 0; pIx + atomProbeIndex < locProbeIndex; pIx++) {
01448         atom->probes[pIx] = &(*locProbes)[pIx + atomProbeIndex];
01449       }
01450     } // atom
01451     psConst.atoms.reserve(locAtomIndex);
01452     for (uint32_t aIx = 0; aIx < locAtomIndex; aIx++) {
01453       if ((*locAtoms)[aIx].probes.size() > 0) {
01454         psConst.atoms.push_back(&(*locAtoms)[aIx]);
01455       }
01456     }
01457     psConst.numGroups = 1; // pgf files only used for expression probesets.
01458     psConst.atomsPerGroup.resize(1);
01459     psConst.atomsPerGroup[0] = psConst.atoms.size();
01460     // if we excluded all the PM probes don't include this probeset.
01461     // we have some mm-only probesets in pgf lib files hence the check
01462     // that the probeset had some pm probes to start with.
01463     if (pmProbeCount == 0 && pmProbePossible > 0)
01464       keepProbeSet = false;
01465 
01466     int probeCount = psConst.countProbes();
01467 
01468     m_ProbeCounts.push_back(probeCount);
01469     // Add to chip level pm, mm, gc counts.
01470     int numBytes = ProbeListPacked::byte_size(psConst.numGroups, probeCount, strlen(psConst.name));
01471     trackGlobalStats(psConst, numBytes);
01472 
01473         // Create the QCProbeMap, one element per probe, value 1 if the probe is a QC probe, otherwise zero
01474         if (m_QCProbeSets.size ())
01475         {
01476                 if (m_QCProbeMap.size () != numProbes)
01477                         m_QCProbeMap.resize (numProbes);
01478 
01479                 for (int iprobe_set=0; iprobe_set<m_QCProbeSets.size (); iprobe_set++)
01480                 {
01481                         const char *name = m_QCProbeSets[iprobe_set].c_str ();
01482 
01483                         if (strcmp (name,psConst.name)==0)
01484                         {
01485                                 for (int iatom=0; iatom<psConst.atoms.size (); iatom++)
01486                                 {
01487                                         Atom *atom = psConst.atoms[iatom];
01488 
01489                                         for (int iprobe=0; iprobe<atom->probes.size (); iprobe++)
01490                                         {
01491                                                 Probe *probe = atom->probes[iprobe];
01492                                                 m_QCProbeMap[probe->id] = 1;
01493 
01494                                                 //{
01495                                                 //      FILE *stream = 0;
01496                                                 //      fopen_s (&stream,"c:\\Users\\Public\\qcc_probe_indexes.txt","a+");
01497                                                 //      if (stream)
01498                                                 //      {
01499                                                 //              fprintf (stream,"%ld\n",probe->id);
01500                                                 //              fclose (stream);
01501                                                 //      }
01502                                                 //}
01503                                         }
01504                                 }
01505                         }
01506                 }
01507         }
01508 
01509     //std::cout << "Probeset: " << psConst << '\n';
01510 
01511     if (keepProbeSet) {
01512       for (int aIx = 0; aIx < psConst.atoms.size(); aIx++) {
01513         for (int pIx = 0; pIx < psConst.atoms[aIx]->probes.size(); pIx++) {
01514           m_ProbeLayoutOrder.push_back(psConst.atoms[aIx]->probes[pIx]->id);
01515         }
01516       }
01517     }
01518 
01519     // Keep it around for processing?
01520     if (psConst.atoms.empty()) {
01521       Verbose::warn(1, "Empty atoms vector for probeset '" + ToStr(psConst.name) +
01522                     "', probeset name '" + psConst.name + "'");
01523     } else {
01524       if (m_SpfFile.is_open() && keepProbeSet) {
01525         writeSpfProbeSetRecord(m_SpfFile, psConst);
01526       }
01527       else if (keepProbeSet && !justStats) {
01528         // ProbeListPacked pList = plFactory.pListFromPSet(psConst);
01529         // plVec.push_back(pList); // store the pointer
01530         plFactory.pListFromPSet(psConst);
01531       }
01532 
01533       // Keep track of ps type
01534       // m_PsTypes.push_back((char)psConst.psType);
01535 
01536       if (probesetNames != NULL) {
01537         probesetNames->push_back(Util::cloneString(psConst.name));
01538       }
01539           if (probesetDisplayNames != NULL) {
01540             probesetDisplayNames->push_back((pgf.probeset_name.empty() == false ? Util::cloneString(pgf.probeset_name.c_str()) : NULL));
01541           }
01542     }
01543 
01544     clearProbeSet(psConst);
01545   } // probeset
01546   if (expectedProbesets > 0) {
01547     Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
01548     if (expectedProbesets > 0 && (seenProbesets != expectedProbesets)) {
01549       Err::errAbort("Expecting: " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets,  got: " + ToStr(seenProbesets));
01550     }
01551   }
01552   delete locProbes;
01553   for (uint32_t aIx = 0; aIx < locAtoms->size(); aIx++) {
01554     (*locAtoms)[aIx].probes.clear();
01555   }
01556   delete locAtoms;
01557   psConst.atomsPerGroup.clear();
01558   psConst.atoms.clear();
01559 }
01560 
01561 /**
01562  * Open a file and parse the probe sets.
01563  * @param fileName - Name of file to be opened.
01564  * @param probeSetsToLoad - Which probe sets should be loaded?
01565  * @param probeSubset - Subset of probes to be loaded.
01566  * @param chipType - What sort of chip should this cdf file be for?
01567  * @param probesetNames - If not null filled in with the
01568  * probesetname for each probeset even if not actually into
01569  * chiplayout. Useful for chp files where every single probeset must
01570  * be included and in order.
01571  * @param - killList map of probes that are to be excluded from
01572  * the probesets. A probe must have its id mapped to the probeset name
01573  * for this to work.
01574  * @param justStats - just read and generate stats, don't load into memory.
01575  * @param psTypesToLoad - What types of probesets to load into memory.
01576  * @return bool - true if success. Errors out on problems.
01577  */
01578 bool ChipLayout::openCdf(const std::string& fileName,
01579                          const std::set<const char *, 
01580                          Util::ltstr> &probeSetsToLoad,
01581                          std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
01582                          std::vector<bool> &probeSubset,
01583                          const std::string &chipType,
01584                          probeidmap_t &killList,
01585                          bool justStats,
01586                          std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> &psTypesToLoad) {
01587   FusionCDFData *cdf = new FusionCDFData();
01588   FusionCDFData *cdfFileHeader = new FusionCDFData();
01589   //m_HaveNames = true;
01590 
01591   std::string cdf_unc_name=Fs::convertToUncPath(fileName);
01592   cdfFileHeader->SetFileName(cdf_unc_name.c_str());
01593 
01594   if (!killList.empty())
01595     m_haveKillList = true;
01596 
01597   if (!(cdfFileHeader->Exists())) {
01598     delete cdf;
01599     delete cdfFileHeader;
01600     Err::errAbort("Can't open CDF file " + FS_QUOTE_PATH(cdf_unc_name) + " to read.");
01601   }
01602   if (!cdfFileHeader->ReadHeader()) { // All comes in with one big gulp...
01603     string msg = "Error opening CDF file to read header "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(cdf_unc_name)
01604       +": " + cdf->GetError();
01605     delete cdf;
01606     delete cdfFileHeader;
01607     Err::errAbort(msg);
01608   }
01609   if (chipType != "") {
01610     vector<std::string> chipTypes = cdfFileHeader->GetChipTypes();
01611     bool match = false;
01612     for (int i = 0; i < chipTypes.size(); i++)
01613       if (chipTypes[i] == chipType) {
01614         match = 1;
01615         break;
01616       }
01617     if (!match) {
01618       string msg = "Cdf file: " + fileName + " is of type " + chipTypes[0] + " but chip type: " +
01619         chipType + " was requested.";
01620       delete cdf;
01621       delete cdfFileHeader;
01622       Err::errAbort(msg);
01623     }
01624   }
01625 
01626   // 
01627   m_Header["chip_type"].push_back(cdfFileHeader->GetChipType());
01628   m_Header["lib_set_name"].push_back(cdfFileHeader->GetFileName());
01629   m_Header["lib_set_version"].push_back( cdfFileHeader->GetFileName());
01630   m_Header["cdf-guid"].push_back( cdfFileHeader->GetGUID() );
01631 
01632   FusionCDFFileHeader &cdfHeader = cdfFileHeader->GetHeader();
01633   /* there is nothing here...*/
01634   Verbose::out(2, "There are: " + ToStr(cdfHeader.GetNumProbeSets()) + " probesets.");
01635   string numProbesets = ToStr(cdfHeader.GetNumProbeSets());
01636   m_Header["cdf_total_probesets"].push_back(numProbesets);
01637   setDimensions(cdfHeader.GetCols(), cdfHeader.GetRows());
01638   if (probeSubset.empty()) {
01639     probeSubset.resize(cdfHeader.GetCols() * cdfHeader.GetRows(), false);
01640   }
01641   cdfFileHeader->Close();
01642   delete cdfFileHeader;
01643   
01644   if (m_SpfFileName != "") {
01645     openSpfForWrite(m_SpfFile,m_SpfFileName);
01646   }
01647 
01648   cdf->SetFileName(cdf_unc_name.c_str());
01649   if (!cdf->Read()) { // All comes in with one big gulp...
01650     string msg = "Error opening CDF file: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(cdf_unc_name)+": " + cdf->GetError();
01651     delete cdf;
01652     Err::errAbort(msg);
01653   }
01654 
01655   /* Convert cdf to probe sets. */
01656   readProbeListCdfFileKillList( *cdf, 
01657                                 m_PlFactory, 
01658                                 probeSetsToLoad,
01659                                 probesetNames, 
01660                                 probeSubset, 
01661                                 killList, 
01662                                 justStats,
01663                                 psTypesToLoad);
01664   /* Make our lookup maps. */
01665   if (!justStats) {
01666     makePsMaps();
01667   }
01668   Verbose::out(2, "Loaded " + ToStr(getProbeSetCount()) + " probe sets.");
01669   if (m_SpfFile.is_open())
01670     m_SpfFile.close();
01671 
01672   delete cdf;
01673   return true;
01674 }
01675 
01676 /**
01677  * Write out the contents of probe sets in PGF format.
01678  * @param fileName - File to write data to.
01679  * @param vec - Vector of probe sets to be stored.
01680  */
01681 void ChipLayout::writePgfFile(const std::string& fileName, 
01682                               const std::vector<ProbeSet *> &vec) {
01683   affx::PgfFile pgf;
01684 
01685   pgf.defineFilePgf();
01686 
01687   pgf.write(fileName);
01688   writePgfFile(pgf,vec);
01689   pgf.close();
01690 }
01691 
01692 /**
01693  * Write the vector of probesets to a PGF file
01694  * @param pgf - Pgf to write to
01695  * @param vec -
01696  */
01697 /// @todo shouldnt this be called "writePgfProbeSetVector"?
01698 void ChipLayout::writePgfFile(affx::PgfFile& pgf, 
01699                               const std::vector<ProbeSet *> &vec) {
01700 
01701   ProbeSet* probeset;
01702   Atom*     atom;
01703   Probe*    probe;
01704 
01705   for (unsigned int probeset_i = 0;probeset_i < vec.size(); probeset_i++) {
01706     probeset=vec[probeset_i];
01707     // write a probeset
01708     pgf.m_tsv.set(0,"probeset_id"  ,ToStr(probeset->name));
01709     ///@todo type here is not right - should not be probeset ID
01710     //pgf.m_tsv.set(0,"type"  ,(int)probeset->id);
01711     //pgf.m_tsv.set(0,"probeset_name",probeset->name);
01712     pgf.m_tsv.writeLevel(0);
01713 
01714     for (unsigned int atom_i = 0;atom_i < probeset->atoms.size(); atom_i++) {
01715       atom=probeset->atoms[atom_i];
01716       // write an atom
01717       pgf.m_tsv.set(1,"atom_id",(int)atom->id);
01718       pgf.m_tsv.writeLevel(1);
01719 
01720       for (unsigned int probe_i = 0;probe_i < atom->probes.size(); probe_i++) {
01721         probe=atom->probes[probe_i];
01722         // write a probe
01723         pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"probe_id"              ,(int)probe->id);
01724         pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"type"                  ,Probe::stringForType((Probe::ProbeType)probe->type));
01725         pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"gc_count"              ,(int)probe->gcCount);
01726         /// @todo  these were not defined in ProbeSet.h so we cant write them out.
01727         //pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"probe_length"          ,25);
01728         //pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"interrogation_position",13);
01729         //pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"probe_sequence"        ,"ACAACGACCGTTCCGGAATCGACAT");
01730         //pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"exon_position"         ,1703);
01731         pgf.m_tsv.writeLevel(2);
01732       }
01733     }
01734   }
01735 }
01736 
01737 /**
01738  * Turn the x and y cordinates of a probe on the array into an index. Should
01739  * be exactly the same index as provided by cel files.
01740  *
01741  * @param x - x coordinate on array.
01742  * @param y - y coordinate on array.
01743  * @return - index (id) of feature in cel file and other arrays.
01744  */
01745 int ChipLayout::xyToIndex(int x, int y) {
01746   return FusionCELData::XYToIndex(x,y,m_YCount,m_XCount);
01747 }
01748 
01749 
01750 /**
01751  * Convert from numeric representation to string.
01752  * @param type - numeric representation.
01753  */
01754 const char *ChipLayout::typeFromCdfType(unsigned short type) {
01755   switch(type) {
01756   case affxcdf::UnknownProbeSetType :
01757     return "unknown";
01758   case affxcdf::ExpressionProbeSetType :
01759     return "expression";
01760   case affxcdf::GenotypingProbeSetType :
01761     return "genotype";
01762   case affxcdf::ResequencingProbeSetType :
01763     return "reseq";
01764   case affxcdf::TagProbeSetType :
01765     return "tag";
01766   case affxcdf::CopyNumberProbeSetType :
01767     return "copynumber";
01768   default :
01769     Err::errAbort("Don't recognize probe set type: " + ToStr(type));
01770   }
01771   return NULL;
01772 }
01773 
01774 /**
01775  * Is this probe a perfect match probe?
01776  * @param cel - probe information from cdf.
01777  * @return true if probe is a perfect match, false otherwise.
01778  */
01779 bool ChipLayout::isPm(const FusionCDFProbeInformation &cel) {
01780   char pBase = 'x', tBase = 'x';
01781   pBase = tolower(cel.GetPBase());
01782   tBase = tolower(cel.GetTBase());
01783   if ((pBase == 'a' && tBase == 't') ||
01784      (pBase == 't' && tBase == 'a') ||
01785      (pBase == 'c' && tBase == 'g') ||
01786      (pBase == 'g' && tBase == 'c')) {
01787     return true;
01788   }
01789   return false;
01790 }
01791 
01792 /**
01793  * Check to see if a charater is a valid DNA base of 'a','t','g', or 'c'
01794  * @param c - base to check.
01795  * @return - return true if c is in 'atgcATGC', false otherwise.
01796  */
01797 bool ChipLayout::validBase(int c) {
01798   c =  tolower(c);
01799   if (c == 'a' || c == 't' || c == 'g' || c == 'c')
01800     return true;
01801   return false;
01802 }
01803 
01804 /**
01805  * Read cdf probe information into a Probe object.
01806  *
01807  * @param p - probe object to be filled in.
01808  * @param parent - Atom that is parent of this probe.
01809  * @param numCol - column on chip.
01810  * @param numRow - row on chip.
01811  * @param direction - target direction.
01812  * @param group - group information from cdf.
01813  * @param cel -probe information from cdf.
01814  */
01815 void ChipLayout::readCdfProbe(  Probe *p, 
01816                                 Atom *parent, 
01817                                 unsigned int numCol, 
01818                                 unsigned int numRow,
01819                                 unsigned int direction,
01820                                 const FusionCDFProbeGroupInformation &group,
01821                                 const FusionCDFProbeInformation &cel) {
01822   int x = 0, y = 0;
01823   char pBase = 'x', tBase = 'x';
01824   // Do the first probe, often mismatch.
01825   x = cel.GetX();
01826   y = cel.GetY();
01827 
01828   pBase = cel.GetPBase();
01829   tBase = cel.GetTBase();
01830   p->gcCount = (char)NULLPROBEGC;
01831   p->id = xyToIndex(x,y);
01832   /* When pBase is same as tBase it is a mismatch probe
01833      as not complementary. */
01834   /* If target is complementary to probe it is a pm probe. */
01835   if (isPm(cel)) {
01836     if (direction == affxcdf::SenseDirection)
01837       p->type = Probe::PMST;
01838     else if (direction == affxcdf::AntiSenseDirection)
01839       p->type = Probe::PMAT;
01840     else
01841       p->type = Probe::PMAT;
01842     ///@todo there should be a Probe::PM type where direction is not known
01843   }
01844   /* mismatches choise can be constrained by cross hybe on snps. */
01845   else if (validBase(pBase) && validBase(tBase)) {
01846     if (direction == affxcdf::SenseDirection)
01847       p->type = Probe::MMST;
01848     else if (direction == affxcdf::AntiSenseDirection)
01849       p->type = Probe::MMAT;
01850     else
01851       p->type = Probe::MMAT;
01852     ///@todo there should be a Probe::PM type where direction is not known
01853   }
01854   else {
01855     Verbose::out(1, "Don't recognize probe type with tbase: '" + ToStr(tBase) + "'"
01856                  " and pbase: '" + ToStr(pBase) + "' at x,y: " + ToStr(x) + "," + ToStr(y));
01857   }
01858 
01859 }
01860 
01861 /**
01862  * Is a particular probe in the kill list (i.e. not to be used?)
01863  * @param probeIx - Id of probe.
01864  * @param psName - Name of probeset that contains probe.
01865  * @param killList - Map of probes not to be used.
01866  * @return true if probe id is in kill list, false otherwise.
01867  */
01868 bool ChipLayout::inKillList(probeid_t probeId, 
01869                             const std::string& psName, 
01870                             probeidmap_t &killList) {
01871   /* simplest case. */
01872   if (killList.empty())
01873     return false;
01874   /* see if this probe is in the kill list. */
01875   probeidmap_t::iterator iter;
01876   iter = killList.find(probeId);
01877   if (iter == killList.end())
01878     return false;
01879   /* check probeset */
01880   std::vector<std::string>::iterator psIter = find(killList[probeId].begin(),killList[probeId].end(),psName);
01881   if (psIter == killList[probeId].end())
01882     return false;
01883   return true;
01884 }
01885 
01886 
01887 
01888 
01889 /**
01890  * Read a vector of ProbeSets from a cdf file representation.
01891  *
01892  * @param cdf - cdf file object with probe set information.
01893  * @param psVec - vector to put newly created probe sets in.
01894  * @param probeSetsToLoad - which probe sets should be converted.
01895  * @param probeSubSet - which individual probes were loaded.
01896  * @param probesetNames - If not null filled in with the
01897  * probesetname for each probeset even if not actually into
01898  * chiplayout. Useful for chp files where every single probeset must
01899  * be included and in order.
01900  * @param killList - map of probes ids that shouldn't be used. Map should
01901  * be of probe ids to probeset names. If a probe is in the map it will
01902  * be excluded as well as matching MM probe (or PM if probe is MM). We check
01903  * to make sure that the string that the user is mapping the probe to the same
01904  * probeset as the cdf does.
01905  */
01906 
01907 #define READCDFPROBESET_ERR_MSG "ERROR: readCdfProbeSet(): "
01908 
01909 /// @brief     
01910 /// @param     name      
01911 /// @param     set       
01912 /// @param     psIx      
01913 /// @param     numCol    
01914 /// @param     numRow    
01915 /// @param     probeSubSet
01916 /// @param     keepProbeSet
01917 /// @param     killList  
01918 /// @param     ps        
01919 /// @param     psNameSize
01920 /// @param     locAtoms  
01921 /// @param     locProbes 
01922 /// @param     errorCount   Count of errors so far.
01923 void ChipLayout::readCdfProbeSet(const std::string& name,
01924                                  FusionCDFProbeSetInformation &set,
01925                                  unsigned int psIx, 
01926                                  int numCol, int numRow,
01927                                  std::vector<bool> &probeSubSet, 
01928                                  bool &keepProbeSet,
01929                                  probeidmap_t &killList,
01930                                  ProbeSet &ps, 
01931                                  int &psNameSize, 
01932                                  std::vector<Atom> **locAtoms,
01933                                  std::vector<Probe> **locProbes,
01934                                  int& errorCount)
01935 {
01936   // *Warning* This function has evolved into quite a behemoth with a
01937   // series of feature requests and no time to refactor it, be
01938   // careful with modifications.
01939   FusionCDFProbeGroupInformation group;
01940   FusionCDFProbeInformation cel1, cel2;
01941   int locAtomIndex = 0, locProbeIndex = 0;
01942   clearProbeSet(ps);
01943   int name_size=name.size();
01944   if (name_size + 1 >= psNameSize) {
01945     delete [] ps.name;
01946     ps.name = new char[name_size + 1];
01947     psNameSize = name_size + 1;
01948     ps.name[psNameSize -1] = '\0'; // make sure always null terminated
01949   }
01950   strncpy(ps.name, name.c_str(), psNameSize -1);
01951   affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType set_probesettype=set.GetProbeSetType();
01952   if (set_probesettype == affxcdf::ExpressionProbeSetType)
01953     ps.psType = ProbeSet::Expression;
01954   else if (set_probesettype == affxcdf::GenotypingProbeSetType)
01955     ps.psType = ProbeSet::GenoType;
01956   else if (set_probesettype == affxcdf::CopyNumberProbeSetType)
01957     ps.psType = ProbeSet::Copynumber;
01958   else if (set_probesettype==affxcdf::MarkerProbeSetType)
01959     ps.psType = ProbeSet::Marker;
01960   else if (set_probesettype==affxcdf::MultichannelMarkerProbeSetType)
01961     ps.psType = ProbeSet::MultichannelMarker;
01962   else
01963     ps.psType = ProbeSet::Unknown;
01964   int numGroups = set.GetNumGroups();
01965   if (ps.psType == ProbeSet::GenoType && numGroups != 2 && numGroups != 4) {
01966     // there is a bug in some cdf files where controls are marked as genotyping...
01967     Verbose::out(4, "How can probeset: " + ToStr(ps.name) + " not have 2 or 4 groups and still be genotyping?");
01968   }
01969   ps.atomsPerGroup.resize(numGroups);
01970   int totalAtoms = 0;
01971   for (int groupIx = 0; groupIx < numGroups; groupIx++) {
01972     set.GetGroupInformation(groupIx, group);
01973     totalAtoms += group.GetNumLists();
01974   }
01975   if (locAtomIndex + totalAtoms >= (*locAtoms)->size()) {
01976     Verbose::out(2, "Resizing atom size from: " + ToStr((*locAtoms)->size()) +
01977                  " to " + ToStr((*locAtoms)->size() + totalAtoms + MAX_ATOMS));
01978     resizeAtoms(locAtoms, (*locAtoms)->size() + totalAtoms + MAX_ATOMS, &ps);
01979   }
01980   ps.atoms.reserve(totalAtoms);
01981   // For each group (block?) read all the atoms. 
01982   for (int groupIx = 0; groupIx < numGroups; groupIx++) {
01983     bool expectingMisMatches = false;
01984     set.GetGroupInformation(groupIx, group);
01985     unsigned short direction = group.GetDirection();
01986     int numAtoms = group.GetNumLists();
01987     int goodAtoms = 0;
01988 
01989     // Have to be two probes per list (atom) to have a pm & mm probe.
01990     // Don't trust the GetNumCellsPerList() function, sometimes lies...
01991     if (set.GetNumLists() != 0 &&
01992        set.GetNumCells() / set.GetNumLists() == 2)
01993       expectingMisMatches = true;
01994     // Read in each atom.
01995     int cellCount = 0; // Keep track of how many cells from this group we've seen already.
01996     for (int atomIx = 0; atomIx < numAtoms; atomIx++) {
01997       //
01998       Atom *a = &(**locAtoms)[locAtomIndex++];
01999       a->id = atomIx;
02000 
02001       if (ps.psType == ProbeSet::Marker) {
02002         a->allele_code=group.GetAlleleCode();
02003         a->context_code=group.GetWobbleSituation();
02004       }
02005       else if (ps.psType == ProbeSet::GenoType) {
02006         if ( groupIx % 2 == 0)
02007           a->allele_code=0;
02008         else
02009           a->allele_code=1;
02010       } 
02011       else if (ps.psType == ProbeSet::MultichannelMarker) {
02012         a->allele_code=group.GetAlleleCode();
02013         a->context_code=group.GetWobbleSituation();
02014         a->channel_code=group.GetChannel();
02015         m_numChannels = max(m_numChannels, a->channel_code+1);
02016  affxcdf::ReplicationType set_rep_type = group.GetRepType();
02017  if (set_rep_type == affxcdf::UnknownRepType) {
02018    a->replication_type=Atom::UnknownRepType;
02019  }
02020  else if (set_rep_type == affxcdf::DifferentRepType) {
02021    a->replication_type=Atom::DifferentRepType;
02022  }
02023  else if (set_rep_type == affxcdf::MixedRepType) {
02024    a->replication_type=Atom::MixedRepType;
02025  }
02026  else if (set_rep_type == affxcdf::IdenticalRepType) {
02027    a->replication_type=Atom::IdenticalRepType;
02028  }
02029  else {
02030    Err::errAbort("In ChipLayout::readCdfProbeSet: unknown Atom::ReplicationType: " + ToStr(set_rep_type));
02031  }
02032       }
02033       int numCells = group.GetNumCells();
02034       int probesPerAtom = numCells / numAtoms;
02035 
02036       if (numCells % numAtoms != 0) {
02037         Verbose::out(1,READCDFPROBESET_ERR_MSG
02038                      "Don't support atoms with varying number of probes.\n"
02039                      "psIx="+ToStr(psIx)+"\n"
02040                      "name='"+ToStr(name)+"'\n"
02041                      "numCells="+ToStr(numCells)+"\n"
02042                      "numAtoms="+ToStr(numAtoms)+"\n"
02043                      );
02044         // add to the count and punt
02045         errorCount++;
02046         return;
02047       }
02048 
02049       if (locProbeIndex + numCells >= (*locProbes)->size()) {
02050         Verbose::out(2, "Resizing probe pm/mm size from: " + ToStr((*locProbes)->size()) + " to " +
02051                      ToStr((*locProbes)->size() + MAX_PROBES));
02052         resizeProbes(locProbes, (*locProbes)->size() + numCells + MAX_PROBES, *locAtoms, locAtomIndex);
02053       }
02054 
02055       int atomProbeIndex = locProbeIndex;
02056       for (int cellIx = 0; cellIx < probesPerAtom; cellIx++) {
02057         if (expectingMisMatches) {
02058 
02059           // Allocate pm & mm probes
02060           Probe *pm = &(**locProbes)[locProbeIndex++];
02061           Probe *mm = &(**locProbes)[locProbeIndex++];
02062           // Look up two possibilities.
02063           group.GetCell(cellCount+cellIx, cel1);
02064           group.GetCell(cellCount+cellIx+1, cel2);
02065           cellCount += 2;
02066 
02067           // Sanity check.
02068           if (cel1.GetListIndex() != cel2.GetListIndex()) {
02069             Verbose::out(1,"ERROR: readCdfProbeSet(): "
02070                          "Expecting pm & mm probes to have same list index in cdf.\n"
02071                          "probeset '"+ToStr(ps.name)+"' "
02072                          "psIx="+ToStr(psIx)
02073                          );
02074 
02075             //
02076             errorCount++;
02077             return;
02078           }
02079    // @todo? check atom rep_type before trying to read mm?
02080           // make sure we read pm/mm correctly or die trying...
02081           if (ChipLayout::isPm(cel1)) {
02082             readCdfProbe(pm, a, numCol, numRow, direction, group, cel1);
02083             readCdfProbe(mm, a, numCol, numRow, direction, group, cel2);
02084           }
02085           else if (ChipLayout::isPm(cel2)) {
02086             readCdfProbe(pm, a, numCol, numRow, direction, group, cel2);
02087             readCdfProbe(mm, a, numCol, numRow, direction, group, cel1);
02088           }
02089           else {
02090             Verbose::out(1,READCDFPROBESET_ERR_MSG
02091                          "Expecting a mismatch probe. "
02092                          "probeset '"+ToStr(ps.name)+"' "+
02093                          "psIx="+ToStr(psIx)
02094                          );
02095             //
02096             errorCount++;
02097             return;
02098           }
02099           /* if either of the probes are on the kill list the get tossed like never
02100              existed. */
02101           // @todo inKillList should have zero-based indexes stored.
02102           bool pmInKillList = inKillList(FROM_ZEROBASED(pm->id), ps.name, killList);
02103           if (pmInKillList) {
02104             Verbose::out(4,"Ignoring probe " + ToStr(FROM_ZEROBASED(pm->id)) + " in probeset " + ToStr(ps.name) + " due to kill list");
02105             // as the mm probe is behind the pm probe have to put the mm probe in the pm probes place.
02106             *pm = *mm;
02107             clearProbe(*mm);
02108             mm = pm;
02109             pm = NULL;
02110             locProbeIndex--;
02111           }
02112           if (inKillList(FROM_ZEROBASED(mm->id), ps.name, killList)) {
02113             Verbose::out(4,"Ignoring probe " + ToStr(FROM_ZEROBASED(mm->id)) + " in probeset " + ToStr(ps.name) + 
02114                          " due to kill list");
02115             clearProbe(*mm);
02116             locProbeIndex--;
02117             mm = NULL;
02118           } else if (pmInKillList) {
02119             Verbose::out(4,"Ignoring MM probe " + ToStr(FROM_ZEROBASED(mm->id)) + " in probeset " + ToStr(ps.name) +
02120                          " due to PM in kill list");
02121             clearProbe(*mm);
02122             locProbeIndex--;
02123             mm = NULL;
02124           }
02125 
02126           // If these probes are to be kept, then make sure we keep the probeset
02127           if (!probeSubSet.empty() && ((pm != NULL && probeSubSet[pm->id]) || (mm != NULL && probeSubSet[mm->id])))
02128             keepProbeSet = true;
02129           // If we got order of pm & mm probes right put them in atoms.
02130           if ((pm == NULL || pm->type == Probe::PMST || pm->type == Probe::PMAT) &&
02131              (mm == NULL || mm->type == Probe::MMST || mm->type == Probe::MMAT)) {
02132             if (pm != NULL) {
02133               m_PmProbes[pm->id] = true;
02134               //              a->probes[cellIx] = pm;
02135             }
02136             if (mm != NULL && !m_MmProbes.empty()) {
02137               m_MmProbes[mm->id] = true;
02138               //              a->probes[cellIx] = mm;
02139             }
02140           }
02141           // Yikes, what did we get? Aborting...
02142           else {
02143             Verbose::out(1,READCDFPROBESET_ERR_MSG
02144                          "Expected to get a pm and mm probe pair in cdf file, but didn't."
02145                          "probeset '"+ToStr(ps.name)+"' "+
02146                          "psIx="+ToStr(psIx)
02147                          );
02148             //
02149             errorCount++;
02150             return;
02151           }
02152           // Increment cellIx by +1 as we read in two probes.
02153           cellIx++;
02154         }
02155         else {
02156           if (cellCount >= numCells) {
02157             Verbose::out(1, "WARNING: This probe set appears to be malformed in the CDF:\t" + name + 
02158                          "\tAtomCount:" + ToStr(numAtoms) + "\tCellCount:" + ToStr(cellCount) +
02159                          "\tProbesPerAtom:" + ToStr(probesPerAtom)); Err::errAbort("Test");
02160             continue;
02161           }
02162           // Just read a singleton.
02163           if (locProbeIndex + 1 >= (*locProbes)->size()) {
02164             Verbose::out(2, "Resizing probe pm only size from: " + ToStr((*locProbes)->size()) +
02165                          " to " + ToStr((*locProbes)->size() + MAX_PROBES));
02166             resizeProbes(locProbes, (*locProbes)->size() + MAX_PROBES, *locAtoms, locAtomIndex);
02167           }
02168           Probe *p = &(**locProbes)[locProbeIndex++];
02169           //          p->parentAtom = a;
02170           group.GetCell(cellCount, cel1);
02171           cellCount++;
02172           readCdfProbe(p, a, numCol, numRow, direction, group, cel1);
02173           // If user has chosen to exclude this probe from probeset don't add it.
02174           if (inKillList(FROM_ZEROBASED(p->id), ps.name, killList)) {
02175             Verbose::out(4,"Ignoring probe " + ToStr(p->id+1) + " in probeset " + ToStr(ps.name) + " due to kill list");
02176             clearProbe(*p);
02177             locProbeIndex--;
02178           }
02179           else {
02180             // If this probes is to be kept, then make sure we keep the probeset
02181             if (!probeSubSet.empty() && probeSubSet[p->id])
02182               keepProbeSet = true;
02183             if (p->type == Probe::PMST || p->type == Probe::PMAT) {
02184               m_PmProbes[p->id] = true;
02185             }
02186             else if ((p->type == Probe::MMAT || p->type == Probe::MMST) && !(m_MmProbes.empty())) {
02187               m_MmProbes[p->id] = true;
02188             }
02189           }
02190         }
02191         a->probes.resize(locProbeIndex - atomProbeIndex);
02192         for (uint32_t pIx = 0; pIx < locProbeIndex - atomProbeIndex; pIx++) {
02193           a->probes[pIx] = &(**locProbes)[pIx + atomProbeIndex];
02194         }
02195       }
02196       //      a->parentPSet = &ps;
02197       if (a->probes.size() > 0) {
02198         ps.atoms.push_back(a);
02199         goodAtoms++;
02200       }
02201     } // end for (int atomIx = 0; atomIx < numAtoms; atomIx++) 
02202     ps.numGroups++;
02203     ps.atomsPerGroup[groupIx] = numAtoms;
02204     if (numAtoms != goodAtoms) {
02205       ps.atomsPerGroup[groupIx] = goodAtoms;
02206     }
02207   } // end for (int groupIx = 0; groupIx < numGroups; groupIx++) 
02208 }
02209 
02210 /**
02211  * Read a vector of ProbeSets from a cdf file representation.
02212  *
02213  * @param cdf - cdf file object with probe set information.
02214  * @param psVec - vector to put newly created probe sets in.
02215  * @param probeSetsToLoad - which probe sets should be converted.
02216  * @param probeSubSet - which individual probes were loaded.
02217  * @param probesetNames - If not null filled in with the
02218  * probesetname for each probeset even if not actually into
02219  * chiplayout. Useful for chp files where every single probeset must
02220  * be included and in order.
02221  * @param killList - map of probes ids that shouldn't be used.
02222  * @param justStats - just read and generate stats, don't load into memory.
02223  * @param psTypesToLoad - What types of probesets to load into memory.
02224  */
02225 void 
02226 ChipLayout::readProbeListCdfFileKillList(FusionCDFData &cdf,
02227                                          ProbeListFactory &plFactory,
02228                                          const std::set<const char *, 
02229                                          Util::ltstr> &probeSetsToLoad,
02230                                          std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
02231                                          std::vector<bool> &probeSubSet,
02232                                          probeidmap_t &killList,
02233                                          bool justStats,
02234                                          std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> &psTypesToLoad)
02235 {
02236   int numCol = 0, numRow = 0;
02237   bool keepProbeSet = false;
02238   FusionCDFProbeSetInformation set;
02239   FusionCDFFileHeader &cdfHeader = cdf.GetHeader();
02240   numCol = cdfHeader.GetCols();
02241   numRow = cdfHeader.GetRows();
02242   uint32_t numProbes = numCol * numRow;
02243   resizeStats(numProbes);
02244   assert(probeSubSet.size() == 0 || probeSubSet.size() == numProbes);
02245   int expectedProbesets = cdfHeader.GetNumProbeSets();
02246   //m_PsTypes.reserve(expectedProbesets);
02247 
02248   // Set up some local static storage. Once a probeset is determined
02249   // to be kept we will allocate memory on the heap for it. Trying to
02250   // prevent lots of new and deletes as they can fragement memory.
02251   ProbeSet psConst;
02252   int psConstMaxName = 256;
02253   psConst.name = new char[psConstMaxName];
02254   psConst.name[psConstMaxName -1] = '\0'; // null terminate.
02255   vector<Atom> *locAtoms = new vector<Atom>(MAX_ATOMS);
02256   vector<Probe> *locProbes = new vector<Probe>(MAX_PROBES);
02257   std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr>::const_iterator emptyIter = probeSetsToLoad.end();
02258   /* Loop through probesets, reading in each one. */
02259   unsigned int dotMod = max(expectedProbesets/40,1);
02260   Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Reading " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets", 40, dotMod, expectedProbesets);
02261   unsigned int seenProbesets = 0, keptProbesets = 0;
02262 
02263   int errorCount=0; // the count of errors from readCdfProbeSet
02264 
02265   for (int psIx = 0; psIx < expectedProbesets; psIx++) {
02266     Verbose::progressStep(1);
02267     seenProbesets++;
02268     keepProbeSet = false;
02269     cdf.GetProbeSetInformation(psIx, set);
02270     // If we're not loading this type of probeset ignore it totally...
02271     if (!psTypesToLoad.empty() && 
02272         psTypesToLoad.find(set.GetProbeSetType()) == psTypesToLoad.end()) {
02273       continue;
02274     }
02275     enum affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType type = set.GetProbeSetType();
02276     if (type != affxcdf::ExpressionProbeSetType &&
02277         type != affxcdf::GenotypingProbeSetType &&
02278         type != affxcdf::CopyNumberProbeSetType &&
02279         type != affxcdf::MarkerProbeSetType     &&
02280  type != affxcdf::MultichannelMarkerProbeSetType &&
02281         type != affxcdf::UnknownProbeSetType) {
02282       Verbose::out(1,"Only know how to parse expression, genotyping, copynumber, marker, multichannel and unknown probesets. "
02283                    "Got type: " + ToStr(type) + " for probeset: " + ToStr(cdf.GetProbeSetName(psIx)) + ". "
02284                    "Treating as unknown.");
02285     }
02286     readCdfProbeSet(cdf.GetProbeSetName(psIx), 
02287       set, 
02288       psIx,
02289       numCol, 
02290       numRow,
02291       probeSubSet, 
02292       keepProbeSet, 
02293       killList,
02294       psConst, 
02295       psConstMaxName, 
02296       &locAtoms, 
02297       &locProbes,
02298       errorCount);
02299 
02300     if (probesetNames != NULL) {
02301       probesetNames->push_back(Util::cloneString(psConst.name));
02302     }
02303 
02304     /* Remember the type in case this probeset isn't actually
02305        loaded. Convert type to expression if a "false" genotype
02306        probeset. */
02307     /*
02308     //This is now done in ChipLayout::getprobesettype
02309     if (psConst.psType == ProbeSet::GenoType && psConst.numGroups != 2 && psConst.numGroups != 4) {
02310     m_PsTypes.push_back((char)ProbeSet::Expression);
02311     }
02312     else {
02313     m_PsTypes.push_back((char)psConst.psType);
02314     }
02315     */
02316 
02317     /* If this probe set is to be loaded do so otherwise free up memory. */
02318     keepProbeSet = true;
02319     if (!probeSetsToLoad.empty() && 
02320         probeSetsToLoad.find(psConst.name) == emptyIter)
02321       keepProbeSet = false;
02322 
02323     /* If all the probes in this probeset were on the kill list don't include it. */
02324     int probeCount = psConst.countProbes();
02325     if (probeCount == 0) {
02326       keepProbeSet = false;
02327     }
02328     /// @todo if we arent keeping the probeset which has an error, then maybe we should ignore the error
02329     ///       on that probeset and not abort.
02330 
02331     m_ProbeCounts.push_back(probeCount);
02332     int numBytes = ProbeListPacked::byte_size(psConst.numGroups, 
02333                                               probeCount, 
02334                                               strlen(psConst.name));
02335     trackGlobalStats(psConst, numBytes);
02336 
02337     if (keepProbeSet) {
02338       keptProbesets++;
02339       for (int aIx = 0; aIx < psConst.atoms.size(); aIx++) {
02340         for (int pIx = 0; pIx < psConst.atoms[aIx]->probes.size(); pIx++) {
02341           m_ProbeLayoutOrder.push_back(psConst.atoms[aIx]->probes[pIx]->id);
02342         }
02343       }
02344 
02345       if (m_SpfFile.is_open()) {
02346         writeSpfProbeSetRecord(m_SpfFile, psConst);
02347       }
02348       else if (!justStats) {
02349         for (unsigned int aIx = 0; aIx < psConst.atoms.size(); aIx++) {
02350           Atom &a = *(psConst.atoms[aIx]);
02351           for (unsigned int probeIx = 0; probeIx < a.probes.size(); probeIx++) {
02352             Probe &p = *(a.probes[probeIx]);
02353             probeSubSet[p.id] = true;
02354           }
02355         }
02356         /* If somebody has specified all the probes on the kill list we
02357            can have a situation with no probes... */
02358         //ProbeListPacked pList = plFactory.pListFromPSet(psConst);
02359         //plVec.push_back(pList); // store the pointer
02360         plFactory.pListFromPSet(psConst);
02361       }
02362     }
02363     clearProbeSet(psConst);
02364   }
02365 
02366   Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
02367   if (expectedProbesets > 0 && (seenProbesets != expectedProbesets)) {
02368     Err::errAbort("Expecting: " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets, got: " + ToStr(seenProbesets));
02369   }
02370   Verbose::out(1,"Kept " + ToStr(keptProbesets) + " probesets.");
02371 
02372   delete locProbes;
02373   for (uint32_t aIx = 0; aIx < locAtoms->size(); aIx++) {
02374     (*locAtoms)[aIx].probes.clear();
02375   }
02376 
02377   psConst.atoms.clear();
02378   psConst.atomsPerGroup.clear();
02379   delete locAtoms;
02380 
02381   // opps! we had one or more errors while reading the CDF file.
02382   if (errorCount!=0) {
02383     Err::errAbort("readCdfProbeSet(): "
02384                   "Encountered "+ToStr(errorCount)+" errors while reading CDF file.");
02385   }
02386 }
02387 
02388 const int ChipLayout::mmId(const int probeIx) const {
02389   if (m_PmMmVec.empty())
02390     Err::errAbort("ChipLayout::mmId() - Appears that chip layout has not been set, no mismatch probes.");
02391   if (probeIx >= m_PmMmVec.size())
02392     Err::errAbort("ChipLayout::mmId() - Probe id: " + ToStr(probeIx + 1) + " is off the chip.");
02393   const int mmIx = m_PmMmVec[probeIx];
02394   if (mmIx == NODATA)
02395     Err::errAbort("ChipLayout::mmId() - Probe id: " + ToStr(probeIx + 1) + " does not have an MM probe assigned.");
02396   return mmIx;
02397 }
02398 
02399 void ChipLayout::resizeAtoms(std::vector<Atom> **old, 
02400                              int32_t newSize, 
02401                              ProbeSet *ps) {
02402   assert((*old)->size() < newSize);
02403   std::vector<Atom> *larger = new std::vector<Atom>(newSize);
02404   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < (*old)->size(); i++) {
02405     Atom *o = &(**old)[i];
02406     Atom *n = &(*larger)[i];
02407     n->id = o->id;
02408     n->probes.resize(o->probes.size());
02409     for (uint32_t pIx = 0; pIx < n->probes.size(); pIx++) {
02410       n->probes[pIx] = o->probes[pIx];
02411       //      n->probes[pIx]->parentAtom = n;
02412     }
02413     o->probes.clear();
02414     clearAtom(*o);
02415   }
02416   for (uint32_t aIx = 0; aIx < ps->atoms.size(); aIx++) {
02417     ps->atoms[aIx] = &(*larger)[aIx];
02418   }
02419   delete *old;
02420   *old = larger;
02421 }
02422 
02423 
02424 
02425 void ChipLayout::resizeProbes(std::vector<Probe> **old, 
02426                               int32_t newSize,
02427                               std::vector<Atom> *currentAtoms, 
02428                               uint32_t currentAtomCount) {
02429   assert(old);
02430   assert(currentAtoms);
02431   uint32_t origSize = (*old)->size();
02432   assert( origSize < newSize);
02433   std::vector<Probe> *larger = new std::vector<Probe>(newSize);
02434   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < (*old)->size(); i++) {
02435     Probe *o = &(**old)[i];
02436     Probe *n = &(*larger)[i];
02437     (*n) = (*o);
02438   }
02439   int currentProbeIx = 0;
02440   for (uint32_t aIx = 0; aIx < currentAtomCount; aIx++) {
02441     Atom *a = &(*currentAtoms)[aIx];
02442     for (uint32_t pIx = 0; pIx < a->probes.size(); pIx++) {
02443       Probe *o = a->probes[pIx];
02444       Probe *n = &(*larger)[currentProbeIx];
02445       if (o->id != n->id) {
02446         Err::errAbort("ChipLayout::resizeProbes() - Expecting id: " + ToStr(o->id) + " but got id " + ToStr(n->id));
02447       }
02448       a->probes[pIx] = n;
02449       currentProbeIx++;
02450     }
02451   }
02452   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < (*old)->size(); i++) {
02453     Probe *o = &(**old)[i];
02454     clearProbe(*o);
02455   }
02456   delete *old;
02457   *old = larger;
02458 }
02459 
02460 
02461 void ChipLayout::clearProbe(Probe &p) {
02462   p.id = 0;
02463   p.type = Probe::BLANK;
02464   p.gcCount = (char)NULLPROBEGC;
02465   //    p.parentAtom = NULL;
02466 }
02467 
02468 void ChipLayout::clearAtom(Atom &a) {
02469   vector<Probe *>::iterator pIx;
02470   a.id = 0;
02471   for (pIx = a.probes.begin(); pIx != a.probes.end(); ++pIx) {
02472     clearProbe(**pIx);
02473   }
02474   a.probes.resize(0);
02475 }
02476 
02477 void ChipLayout::clearProbeSet(ProbeSet &ps) {
02478   vector<Atom *>::iterator aIx;
02479   for (aIx = ps.atoms.begin(); aIx != ps.atoms.end(); ++aIx) {
02480     clearAtom(**aIx);
02481   }
02482   if (ps.name != NULL) {
02483     ps.name[0] = '\0';
02484   }
02485   ps.psType = ProbeSet::Unknown;
02486   ps.numGroups = 0;
02487   ps.atoms.resize(0);
02488 }
02489 
02490 /**
02491  * Keep track of global stats as we parse through file.
02492  *
02493  * @param name - Name of probeset
02494  * @param type - Class of probeset (as in ProbeSet::Type)
02495  * @param numBlocks - How many blocks are in the probeset.
02496  * @param numMatch - How many matches are there (1 for pm only, 2 for pm-mm)
02497  * @param probes - Vector of the probe ids/indexes in the array.
02498  */
02499 void
02500 ChipLayout::trackGlobalStats(const std::string& name,
02501                              int type,
02502                              int numBlocks,
02503                              const std::vector<int>& blockSizes,
02504                              int numMatch,
02505                              const std::vector<int>& probes,
02506                              bool multAlleles)
02507 {
02508   m_MaxNameLength = Max((int)name.length(), m_MaxNameLength);
02509   int pmStart = 0, pmEnd = probes.size() / numMatch;
02510   int mmStart = probes.size() / numMatch;
02511   int numBytes = ProbeListPacked::byte_size(numBlocks, probes.size(), name.size()+1);
02512   int additionalMem = Util::round(numBytes * .15) + sizeof(ProbeList);
02513   additionalMem += (12 * sizeof(char *) + sizeof(std::pair<const char *,unsigned int>)); // for name map
02514   additionalMem += 16; // for safety
02515   m_ProbesPerProbeset.addData(probes.size());
02516   m_ProbesetMemSizes.addData(numBytes + additionalMem);
02517   m_ProbeCounts.push_back(probes.size());
02518   // make probes that are in a probeset.
02519   for (int pIx = 0; pIx < probes.size(); pIx++) {
02520     if (probes[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe)
02521       m_ProbesetProbes[probes[pIx]] = true;
02522   }
02523   // mark PM probes
02524   for (int pIx = pmStart; pIx < pmEnd; pIx++) {
02525     if (probes[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe)
02526       m_PmProbes[probes[pIx]] = true;
02527   }
02528   // mark MM probes if requested.
02529   if (!m_MmProbes.empty()) {
02530     for (int pIx = pmStart; pIx < pmEnd; pIx++) {
02531       if (probes[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe)
02532         m_MmProbes[probes[pIx]] = true;
02533     }
02534   }
02535   // if MM probes and requested PM->MM matching make it
02536   if (numMatch == 2 && !m_PmMmVec.empty()) {
02537     for (int pIx = pmStart; pIx < pmEnd; pIx++) {
02538       if (probes[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe &&
02539          probes[pIx + mmStart] != ProbeList::null_probe) {
02540         m_PmMmVec[probes[pIx]] = probes[pIx+mmStart];
02541       }
02542     }
02543   }
02544   incrementTypes(type, numBlocks, multAlleles);
02545 }
02546 
02547 void ChipLayout::incrementTypes(int type, int numBlocks, bool multipleAlleles) {
02548   if (type == ProbeSet::Expression || 
02549       (type == ProbeSet::GenoType && numBlocks != 2 && numBlocks != 4)) {
02550     m_NumExpression++;
02551   }
02552   else if ( multipleAlleles && 
02553             (type == ProbeSet::GenoType || 
02554              type == ProbeSet::Marker ||
02555              type == ProbeSet::MultichannelMarker)) {
02556     m_NumGenotyping++;
02557   }
02558 }
02559 
02560 void ChipLayout::trackGlobalStats(ProbeSet &ps, int numBytes) {
02561   Atom *atom = NULL;
02562   Probe *p = NULL;
02563   Probe *pm = NULL, *mm = NULL;
02564   m_MaxNameLength = Max((int)strlen(ps.name), m_MaxNameLength);
02565   bool multAllele = false;
02566   if (!ps.atoms.empty()) {
02567     int first = ps.atoms[0]->allele_code;
02568     for (int i = 1; i < ps.atoms.size(); i++) {
02569       if (ps.atoms[i]->allele_code != first) {
02570         multAllele = true;
02571       }
02572     }
02573   }
02574   incrementTypes(ps.psType, ps.atomsPerGroup.size(), multAllele);
02575 
02576   // 15% more for heap, pointer to name, name and probelist itself.
02577   int additionalMem = Util::round(numBytes * .15) + sizeof(ProbeList);
02578   additionalMem += (12 * sizeof(char *) + sizeof(std::pair<const char *,unsigned int>)); // for name map
02579   additionalMem += 16; // for safety
02580 
02581   m_ProbesPerProbeset.addData(ps.countProbes());
02582   m_ProbesetMemSizes.addData(numBytes + additionalMem);
02583 
02584   //m_ProbeCounts handled by caller
02585   for (uint32_t atomIx = 0; atomIx < ps.atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
02586     uint32_t probeIx = 0;
02587     atom = ps.atoms[atomIx];
02588     /* Do indivitual probe stats. */
02589     for (probeIx = 0; probeIx < atom->probes.size(); probeIx++) {
02590       p = atom->probes[probeIx];
02591       /* Store the gc count for this particular probe. */
02592       if (!m_ProbeGcVec.empty()) {
02593         if (p->id>=m_ProbeGcVec.size()) {
02594           Err::errAbort("trackGlobalStats: Internal error: id ("+ToStr(p->id)+")>=ProbeGcVec.size()");
02595         }
02596         m_ProbeGcVec[p->id] = p->gcCount;
02597       }
02598       /* Keep track of pm and mm probes. */
02599       if (p->type == Probe::PMAT || p->type == Probe::PMST) {
02600         m_PmProbes[p->id] = true;
02601       }
02602       else if ((p->type == Probe::MMAT || p->type == Probe::MMST) && 
02603                !m_MmProbes.empty()) {
02604         m_MmProbes[p->id] = true;
02605       }
02606       if (ps.psType != ProbeSet::Unknown) {
02607         m_ProbesetProbes[p->id] = true;
02608       }
02609     }
02610 
02611     /* Do the pm->mm mapping. */
02612     for (probeIx = 0; probeIx < atom->probes.size() && probeIx < atom->probes.size() - 1; probeIx++) {
02613       pm = atom->probes[probeIx];
02614       mm = atom->probes[probeIx+1];
02615       if (pm->type == Probe::PMST && mm->type == Probe::MMST && !m_PmMmVec.empty())
02616         m_PmMmVec[pm->id] = mm->id;
02617       if (pm->type == Probe::PMAT && mm->type == Probe::MMAT && !m_PmMmVec.empty())
02618         m_PmMmVec[pm->id] = mm->id;
02619     }
02620   }
02621 
02622   if (ps.psType == ProbeSet::GenoType && !m_PmAlleleMatchVec.empty()) {
02623     int atomIndex = 0;
02624     /* Genotype probe sets can have either 2 or 4 groups, for each
02625        type the even (0,2) are A alleles and odd (1,3) are B allele.s */
02626     for (int psIx = 0; psIx < ps.numGroups - 1; psIx += 2) {
02627       Err::check(ps.atomsPerGroup[psIx] == ps.atomsPerGroup[psIx+1],
02628                  "ChipLayout::trackGlobalStats() - Must have matched A and B allele probes when using this analysis. Probeset '" + ToStr(ps.name) + "' has unmatched probe count.");
02629       int atomsPer = ps.atomsPerGroup[psIx];
02630       /* Each block will have atomsPer atoms in there. */
02631       for (int atomIx = 0; atomIx < atomsPer; atomIx++) {
02632         int aIndex = atomIx + (atomIndex);
02633         int bIndex = aIndex + atomsPer;
02634         Atom *A = ps.atoms[aIndex];
02635         Atom *B = ps.atoms[bIndex];
02636         if (A->probes.size() != B->probes.size()) {
02637           Err::errAbort("For probeset '" + ToStr(ps.name) + " A and B alleles must have same number of probes.");
02638         }
02639         for (int probeIx = 0; probeIx < A->probes.size(); probeIx++) {
02640           m_PmAlleleMatchVec[A->probes[probeIx]->id] = B->probes[probeIx]->id;
02641           m_PmAlleleMatchVec[B->probes[probeIx]->id] = A->probes[probeIx]->id;
02642         }
02643       }
02644     }
02645   }
02646 }
02647 
02648 /**
02649  * Reads in probes to kill.
02650  *
02651  * @param fileName - file containing BadProbes
02652  * @param killList - things to kill, determined from file
02653  * @param rows - number of rows in cel file
02654  * @param cols - number of cols in cel file
02655  */
02656 void ChipLayout::fillInKillList(const std::string& fileName, 
02657                                 probeidmap_t &killList, int rows, int cols) {
02658 
02659   assert(fileName!="");
02660   assert(rows > 0);
02661   assert(cols > 0);
02662 
02663   killList.clear();
02664   affx::TsvFile tsv;
02665   int count = 0;
02666   probeidmap_t::iterator mapIter;
02667   vector<string>::iterator psIter;
02668 
02669   bool haveProbeId = false;
02670   bool haveXY = false;
02671 
02672   string psName;
02673   int probeId;
02674   int x,y;
02675 
02676   if (tsv.open(fileName) != TSV_OK)
02677     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + ToStr(fileName) + " to read.");
02678 
02679   if (tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probeset_id") == TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND)
02680     Err::errAbort("Probe kill list file, " + ToStr(fileName) + ", does not have probeset_id column.");
02681   else
02682     tsv.bind(0, "probeset_id", &psName, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
02683 
02684   // We expect either a probe_id column or an x/y column.
02685   if (tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probe_id") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
02686     tsv.bind(0, "probe_id", &probeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
02687     haveProbeId = true;
02688   }
02689   if ((tsv.cname2cidx(0, "x") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) && (tsv.cname2cidx(0, "y") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND)) {
02690     tsv.bind(0, "x", &x, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
02691     tsv.bind(0, "y", &y, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
02692     haveXY = true;
02693   }
02694 
02695   if (!haveProbeId && !haveXY)
02696     Err::errAbort("Kill list file must have either a probe_id column or an x and y column.");
02697 
02698   while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
02699 
02700     int probeIdFromXY = -1;
02701     if (haveXY) {
02702       int rv=affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData::XYToIndex(x,y,rows,cols);
02703       probeIdFromXY = FROM_ZEROBASED(rv);
02704     }
02705 
02706     if (haveProbeId) {
02707       if (haveXY && probeIdFromXY != probeId) {
02708         Err::errAbort("ProbeID value (" + ToStr(probeId) + ") does not match x,y (" +
02709                       ToStr(x) + "," + ToStr(y) + ") based ID (" + ToStr(probeIdFromXY) + ").");
02710       }
02711     } else if (haveXY) {
02712       probeId = probeIdFromXY;
02713     } else {
02714       Err::errAbort("In unexpected part of code. No XY or ProbeID in kill list.");
02715     }
02716 
02717     mapIter = killList.find((uint32_t)probeId);
02718     if (mapIter != killList.end()) {
02719       psIter = find(killList[(uint32_t)probeId].begin(),killList[(uint32_t)probeId].end(),psName);
02720       if (psIter != killList[(uint32_t)probeId].end()) {
02721         Err::errAbort("Probe id: " + ToStr(probeId) + " specified twice in file: " + fileName);
02722       } else {
02723         killList[(uint32_t)probeId].push_back(psName);
02724         count++;
02725       }
02726     } else {
02727       killList[(uint32_t)probeId].push_back(psName);
02728       count++;
02729     }
02730   }
02731   Verbose::out(1, "Loaded: " + ToStr(count) + " probe/probeset pairs to be ignored from: " + Fs::basename(fileName));
02732   tsv.close();
02733 }
02734 
02735 /**
02736  * @brief compare probeset names according to respective probeset ids
02737  * @param a, b - probeset names to be ordered
02738  */
02739 // static bool ChipLayout::compareProbesetNameByProbesetIdx(std::string a, std::string b) {
02740 //   return (getProbeSetIndexByName(a) < getProbeSetIndexByName(b));
02741 // }
02742 
02743 void ChipLayout::sortProbesetNameByProbesetIdx(std::vector<std::string>::iterator begin, std::vector<std::string>::iterator end) {
02744   if (begin < end - 1) {
02745     std::vector<std::string>::iterator right = end - 1;
02746     std::vector<std::string>::iterator left = begin;
02747     std::string temp;
02748     int pivot = getProbeSetIndexByName(*right);
02749     
02750     while (left < right) {
02751       while (left < right && getProbeSetIndexByName(*left) <= pivot) {
02752  left++;
02753       }
02754       while (left < right && pivot < getProbeSetIndexByName(*right)) {
02755  right--;
02756       }
02757       
02758       if (left < right) {
02759  temp = *left;
02760  *left = *right;
02761  *right = temp;
02762       }
02763     }
02764     
02765     sortProbesetNameByProbesetIdx(begin, right);
02766     sortProbesetNameByProbesetIdx(left, end);
02767   }
02768 }
